Reviews.Title: “Very caring, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Miami Conrad, I had the misfortune of suffering a medical emergency. The staff was very caring and helpful and made my stay as comfortable as possible - even providing a free in-room movie to watch during my recovery. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: bekahsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for 3 nights. My husband was there for a meeting, and my daughter and I went along. The hotel was OK, in my opinion. First, the layout of the hotel is rather inconvenient and awkward. We arrived late at night and had a hard time finding the check in lobby, as it is located on the 25th floor. The concierge, who is located on the ground floor, was off duty due to the late hour, and the signs were not clear. Once in the lobby, you must transfer elevators to access guest room floors. Also, you must access two elevators and walk a distance to the pool. The pool area was plain, but very nice and well kept. Towels were provided. The room was very clean, with comfortable beds. It was average size, with nice snacks in the mini bar. Also, the concierge and front desks provided free bottles of water, which was nice. However, I felt the room was way overpriced. Our basic room was $349 a night. Breakfast buffet was good. About the same as I have had at Embassy Suites, another Hilton Hotel. It was reasonably priced given the location and choices, but at $349 a night, I feel it would have been a nice touch to include it with the room price. 22% gratuity was automatically added, but the service was good, so we opted not to change it. Room service food was okay at best, and they got our order wrong. It was expensive, but no more so than you would expect for room service. The staff was excellent. Very friendly valet, front desk, and restaurant staff. The concierge was extremely helpful and friendly. They were the best part of the hotel! Location was fine if you are looking for a meeting place only, which seems to be their specialty. There was a lot of construction around the hotel, which made it a little noisy. Personally, I prefer South Beach area or somewhere else, but there were some restaurants and other things close by. Cab rides to South Beach and most other places we went were about $25-$35, one way, which is expected. Overall, I give the hotel an average rating, with higher marks for cleanliness and service.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: lmgreen
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Conrad before leaving on a cruise from the nearby Miami seaport. Our room was a nice size overlooking the bay with all the amenities that you would expect. All the staff were gracious and eager to please. The buffet breakfast was included in our rate and was more than ample including a cooked to order egg station. We had lunch at the Morton's steak house a block away. They have a weekday lunch for $29 which was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and nice location”
Reviews.Author: sdr82
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are small but nice. The staff is very attentive. After a REALLY late night the door men will personally take you to the upper lobby to make sure you are alright.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent high-rise hotel in the heart of downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: Art918
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 1 night stay here while in downtown Miami for business. Loved being high in the air, with great bay views. Free 24 hour workout facility. Was upgraded to a 1 bedroom corner suite--very large, spacious, & wonderful windows all around with bay views. Staff was friendly. Ate a quick lunch on the outdoor patio (25 stories up), food was very good. Free WIFI throughout hotel; coffee maker in room; mini-bar items not overpriced. Worth a stay if in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect venue for business conference”
Reviews.Author: rgajda
Reviews.Content: I am the Marketing Manager at my company and we hold business conferences several times per year, and it is my responsibility to choose the location and venue. I tend to have very high standards, and the Conrad met every one of them. The hotel itself is gorgeous. From the modern decor to the impeccable views, I was not at all dissapointed. The location was walking distance to a lot of shopping and restaurants, and it was in a safe area of town. The staff throughout the hotel were beyond accommodating. A few examples: 1) I needed a safety pin (emergency wardrobe malfunction) and the girl at the front desk searched through their back office for at least 5 minutes to find one. 2) The waitress at the bar completely customized a food and drink order for my colleague and I because we were being indecisive and couldn't find anything on the menu that we were in the mood for. 3) The staff for our event (specifically Rosie, Ingrid and Manuel) went out of their way to ensure that our expectations were being met. If I had a request, they didn't ask any questions and made it happen. The meeting rooms were great. The windows allowed for a more comfortable feeling in the room, as most hotel meeting rooms are cramped and do not have any natural light. The food was wonderful, and they had many unique options to offer. The hotel room was outstanding. I was upgraded to a suite, and the entire layout was perfect. The bed was comfortable, and since all of the hotel rooms are located on higher floors, you are not disturbed by the hustle and bustle of the Miami streets. Above all else, the quality of the hotel and the meeting services that we received was well worth the average amount of money that was spent. You cannot beat the room rates or the service prices at this hotel. I was very satisfied with my experience at this venue. I will undoubtedly recommend the Conrad to other event planners and will be sure to return here the next time we hold a course in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in Financial District”
Reviews.Author: Philyellen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is incredible. It's situated in a great location for business and still only 25 dollars in a cab from south beach. Service is amazing and so is the breakfast. Gorgeous sea views also. Short walk or take the train opposite to some nice bars and restaurants. I always come back here when in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel and base to see Miami”
Reviews.Author: AZandDZ
Reviews.Content: Modern, good design, excellent facilities and right in the middle of Brickel so the City is accessible from there. The breakfast burritos are excellent if you are feeling greedy

Reviews.Title: “Spacious clean rooms with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: debbieinnc
Reviews.Content: An extremely nice, upscale hotel. Staff is professional, friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and updated. One of the nicer Hiltons. Gold status got us turn-down service which after spending the past 8 days cruising was the perfect end to a vacation. Nice buffet breakfast in the morning with great selections of foods. If there was one strange thing about this hotel - the lobby is on the 25th floor and to get to the sleeping rooms, you need to take another set of elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: momwithlove
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online and got an amazing price! We flew from Canada to Miami and due to flight problems we arrived almost 7 hours later than we expected. My friend and her family checked in ahead of myself and son. When we got to the desk we were told that because they were sold out we were upgraded to a Premium Suite and given our keys. Oh my heavens what a room!!!!! We were given a 2 bedroom apartment compete with full kitchen, living room, 2 four piece bathrooms and balcony. It was so awesome I didnt even want to go on our scheduled tours but would rather remain in the room. Prior to going on this trip we were in contact with Alejandro, concierge with Conrad Hilton, who went over and above what we asked to arrange 2 day tours, transportation and helped with plans prior and post trip. We went on a cruise and then returned for one night and were treated with the same respect as those who stayed a week. When we returned we were given a 'regular' room which was once again very sufficient and plenty of space for the two of us. The bathrooms in this property are huge and the beds are very nice sized. The rooms provide robes and slippers for each guest. The workout room provide a wide array of machines plus snacks and warms towels. The hotel is a bit away from Bayside but a free Metromover is across the street which takes you to Bayside and a few places to shop and places to walk around. The pool area was awesome and we found it more than sufficient for a few nights stay. I cant say enough about this location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Financial District Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Gale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad during the Miami marathon (late January 2012). If you are staying downtown, this is a good choice. I've stayed at other hotels in the downtown/financial district areas and this was the best. Parking is expensive, but we were largely able to park at a meter on the street. Just know that street parking is metered from 7 am until midnight 7 days/week and you can only buy 3-hours at a time (about $5.00). Because we weren't at the hotel much, that was fine. If you are leaving your car in the hotel area for a long time, then it makes sense to pay $26 for 24-hours in the self-parking structure. Breakfast was included in my rate (hilton honors gold). Otherwise, it would have been $60 for the two of us each morning. The buffet was very good and clean, but not sure I would have paid $60 for it. Wireless in the room wasn't the best, but it was okay in the lobby. They also have 2 computers for use with free printing in the lobby. Had a glass of wine one evening in the bar -- also very expensive. The next night we walked next door to a brewery and had drinks for 1/2 the price. The rooms were very clean (though the bedroom was small) and well kept. The lobby was in great shape and the staff was very friendly. Overall, I recommend this hotel for an upscale stay in downtown Miami.

Reviews.Title: “What to say?!”
Reviews.Author: LorJaz2011
Reviews.Content: Being a HiltonHonors gold member I opted for this hotel and took my wife and 3 year old son. Would not do this again. Pool area ok , breakfast buffet very good and most of the staff very friendly. Especially the older african american staff. Friendly, professional and top service. Latin and caucasian staff not that good. Not being racial, as I am half latin half caucasian. I loved the lady behind the egg baking stand. What a lovely lady, she has an intrinsic client service attitude and is amazing with eggs and kids. Valet organised well. Thusfar a top experience, but then the most important element, the room: not good, small, not very clean, no outdoors/balcony, kind of worn and not clean, dark, and smelling moist. Toddler bed reasonable though. Had a 5 day reservation later that week but went to the Epic, #1 inMiami. Also not epic btw. but better than the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Jack O
Reviews.Content: The room and the staff were extremely amazing. Everything was so good. The hotel was very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Gracious staff. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: reviewguy
Reviews.Content: Brickell Ave is well located. Safe secure location. Warm attentive bell desk and valet parking attendants. Lobby on the 25th floor. Warm earthy tones all around. Elizabeth at the front desk made our stay so very special. Thank you, Elizabeth, for all the smiles and help through our stay. We were upgraded to a two room suite which was huge, comfortable, had a telescope to look out into the distance. TV, fridge, two person bathtub, two head shower (incl rainshower), sheets to sink into, comfortable sitting chairs, were just some of the room amenities that were delightful. The only disappointment was in room dining. Food was bland - literally tasteless. Overpriced (but that was expected.) Buffet breakfast, internet thrown in for free for HHonors Gold members. Parking was really expensive at $47+tax a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Rook3rs
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel with an attentive, highly professional, and pleasant staff who are ready to cater to the guests requests. They are polite, helpful, and always willing to find out any information you need. The hotel location is central to downtown Miami and the interstate with the free people mover station across the road. This takes you to Bayside and all round downtown Miami. It is also less than a 5 minute walk to Mary Brickell village with its many eateries and shops. The hotel room is large and comfortable with a good sized bathroom and good storage space. The buffet breakfast is extensive and has all the hot and cold food you could require and it is always well stocked by the ever-present staff. The view over the bay and ocean is a great start to the day. Once you get used to taking one elevator up to the lobby and then another one to the exit, garage, or pool, it is of little consequence. The pool is adequate with the poolside getting the sun being quite narrow. Occasionally this side floods when a swimmer passes by. This is an excellent choice for a few days break in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad Miami on New Year's Eve. I went to the website kayak.com to make my reservations. Kayak redirected me to another website called getaroom.com, since the rates were less. I got the room for $175 per night. I checked the Conrad Miami website on NYE and their rate was $419 per night. I requested a room with 2 beds on my reservation, but when we checked in they told me that there were none available. I asked for a roll away bed, but the front desk said that the current room that I was booked in would not fit a roll away. They said that I would need to pay an extra $40 to upgrade our room to accomodate the extra bed. The hotel and the rooms are very modern. Ate dinner and had the breakfast buffet at their restaurant Atrio. The food was very good. There is free WiFi in the lobby area. We took a taxi to South Beach and it cost $25 each way. Overall, I recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: merijanoo
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here for one night on December 17th. We stayed in a spacious 2 Bedroom residence overlooking the bay. It was a beautiful unit very clean and spacious. The hotel is in a great location and the staff are all excellent. I woul recommend this hotel to everyone. The buffet breakfast is fantastic. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great settings, hotel, location”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay - premises are impeccable and luxurious. The 25th floor lobby is stunning as are the services offered--bar, restaurant, spa and pool. Rooms are modern comfortable and quite with spectacular views. Staff is helpful and accommodating. Stayed at the Four Seasons last time and whilst grand and well appointed, I find the Conrad to be a cozier set up a block away from the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a great location”
Reviews.Author: goditolindo
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property. It has perhaps the most attentive service personnel of any hotel in the area. A phenomenal breakfast buffet and beautiful decor make for an exciting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: OaklandBK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Conrad in Miami several times. Sometimes it is really good, sometimes (like last week) it was just OK. The rooms are good, clean, and well appointed. But some of the rooms are great (like the one I had two trips ago) and others are OK. My bathroom on this trip had a great view! The bar on the 25th floor is good (service and food/wine options aren't great) but it's nice to be able to sit outside. Atrio (the nice restaurant on the 25th floor) is lovely - I ate there for the first time this trip and will eat there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: multitrips
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel and we loved it. Rooms, service- all great. Can't recommend it highly enough. The pool is on the roof of a separate building but the crosswalk is covered so crossing the street in a robe was not as daunting as our daughters thought it would be. All other hotels are spoilt for us now!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel But Needs Some Room Repair & Pool Area Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: TheFlyingFamily
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Conrad Miami for two nights during our visit to Miami over the Thanksgiving weekend. We had a very pleasant stay in a 2 bedroom condo suite. Without question the view of Biscayne Bay, South Beach and the Cruise Port was outstanding. The room amenities were what was expected at a hotel of this caliber. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. The breakfast buffet was expensive but outstanding and worth the price. We enjoyed the close location to the metro-mover which allowed us to leave the car and travel to Bayside for shopping without worrying about parking. There were, however, a couple of issues we found with this hotel that we felt made it not quite perfect: 1> The room, while very nice and certainly spacious, was in need of some basic repair. When we entered the room the refrigerator was leaking water from the door ice dispenser. Water was all over the floor in the kitchen area. Luckily I spotted this before we slipped on the water. I had to adjust the ice dispenser and the problem was solved. If you tried to use the dispenser again, it would malfunction again. Also, the A/C unit did not work well in our unit. We couldn't get our unit to pump out cold air. Fortunately the temps were in the low 60's as night so we were ok but there is no possible way the A/C unit would keep the room cool on an average warm day in Miami. Also, the microwave had a slight burnt smell about it when we used it to warm some water for tea. These are just a few of the minor issues we found with the room that made the stay slightly less than perfect. 2> The pool area. For such an upscale hotel, the pool area is very plain. Looking at other hotels in the area, pools are a gather spot and were more tropical, lush and offered private cabanas. The Conrad pool was plain and basic. Unfortunately even the hot-tub didn't work. Again, nothing earth-shattering but for a hotel such as the Conrad, it should be a no-brainer. A little investment in the overall area would make a big impression. While I would stay at the Conrad again, I would probably try another hotel first to get a better comparison. I must say though I sure liked the size of the 2 bedroom condo suite - it was a pleasant oasis in a crowded city!

Reviews.Title: “Good upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler56
Reviews.Content: I've been at this hotel for a convention. The service is impeccable, and during the check in you can have a beatiful view of Key Biscayne and the bay, being that the lobby is not - as normally - at ground floor. The valet parking is a bit expensive, but you can use the connected parking (not cheap). The rooms are OK, with a huge bathroom. Conference facilities are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Elegance and Class”
Reviews.Author: Ashp501
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, good location, close to bayside and not too far from south beach. Being in the financial district, the hotel has a very secure feel, being high up on the upper levels of a tower with offices below. The hotel inside has great views from the bar and the rooms are spacious and luxurious. There are a fair few restaurants close by and the free tram service runs along Brickell and stops right outside the hotel! The only drawback was the pool is somewhat detached from the hotel, having walk through the car park and into another building to get to the pool isnt great (especially in your swimmers!) Overall a lovely hotel away from the hustle and bustle of South Beach and Down Town.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: SiddMoras
Reviews.Content: The hotel is expensive but very grand. I loved everything about it. the view from the breakfast area is breathtaking. The only issue is that the swimming pool is slightly disjointed from the rest of the hotel. You can avoid parking fees by parking on street which is free between 12 midnight and 7 AM and $3 an hour otherwise. The hotel charges $36.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: firstborn_2006
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel decent location about 15 minutes from South beach but just around the corner from Bayside. There are several restaurants and bars located around the hotel all in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: ilrich
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay here in October 2011 before flying from MIA. An easy 20 minute drive to the airport and just 10 minutes to South Beach. The hotel staff are very slick and very efficient. The views from the 25th floor (check in) are superb, overlooking the port, Biscayne Bay and South Beach. Stayed in a one bed suite, which was magnificent. Spacious, natural light, ipod dock, electric curtains, decent size in room safe, 2 TV's very very plush. Breakfast time during the week will see you sitting in the proximity of some serious Power Breakfast meetings, which adds to the aura of this hotel. Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It is excellent: no quibbles”
Reviews.Author: Heidbummer
Reviews.Content: OK: if you are a Hilton Diamond card holder you are likely to be ahead of the game when you book a room here. Unlike many UK Hiltons who will not upgrade you unless you ask, European and Stateside Hiltons will do so unless they absolutely cannot. Also given breakfast as a courtesy, and whilst others have commented on this upgrade not including the automatic gratuity, it would be churlish to moan about paying $4 for an otherwise free (and excellent) breakfast. Especially when you have that breakfast on the terrace overlooking the bay. Room-wise, over 2 short stays here I was upgraded both times to a large corner residence room with kitchenette and huge living area. It's a seriously good room. Others have commented on the Illy espresso machine: it really is good. Beds are very comfy indeed. Huge bathroom with ample toiletries. All staff are helpful but not "artificial". The bar is good value for a hotel of this status: if this were New York you could easily add 50% to the cost of that martini. The in house restaurant is not cheap but is good value, serves genuinely very very good food (no seasoning required, always a decent benchmark) and the wines are excellent. If you really can't stomach the cost of that (and if you are staying at the Conrad, that does seem a bit unlikely), the Gordon Biersch brewpub a half a block away does excellent diner fare with a twist with good microbrews. Good gym. Handy for public transport for getting around downtown (the metromover is free). Overall, despite its business district location, a high end Hilton group hotel that made me feel welcome, a valued customer, and was uber comfy. This was my first time in Miami. Don't see any reason to stay anywhere else next time. Big thumbs up Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JM_2793
Reviews.Content: Wonderful views, outstanding breakfast,good gym, and extremely helpful staff. I stay here occasionally on business and am looking forward to my next stay in Dec. Walking distance to many good restaurants in Brickell.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night, what a beautiful hotel! The views are amazing, even though we were facing the city... Very handy upscale restaurant in the building... Expensive but worth every penny! Best place I've ever stayed in Miami... The staff were so welcoming and helpful! Next time I'm in Miami I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and great views”
Reviews.Author: wearyn0mad
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 2 nights with my family. This is a beautiful hotel, from the street entrance with overhead water feature to the check in area on the 25th floor with amazing views. We were in a king bed deluxe room - very nicely decorated, large bathroom with separate bathtub and shower, a great Illy coffee machine, and cookies delivered to our room shortly after arrival. The view out towards Biscayne Bay from our 18th floor room was partly obstructed by adjacent buildings but was still spectacular. The only drawback was the noise - a slight gap under the room door allowed noise to easily travel into the room, and doors slamming loudly in the corridor were heard well into the early hours. However the staff were very kind in their response to this. We mentioned this noise issue when a staff member (Emily) happened to phone the room on our second night to check whether we were settling in OK. Obviously not much could be done to remedy the situation, but they called back to offer us complimentary breakfast including gratuity. A different staff member also recognised me in the lobby later and personally discussed the situation with me. The parking & bell staff were similarly very helpful and efficient. All in all, a great hotel and responsive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jason r
Reviews.Content: This is a great business Hotel, in the heart of the business district. The rooms are good although i can only comment on the suites as i receive an upgrade when i check in. The suites are a very good size and command a corner of the building, with glass to two sides. The views over miami were fantastic. The bar and restaraunt were good and the food was excellent. I recommentd the Champagne mojito. Parking at the hotel can be Valet or self park, and i find it easier to self park and its $10 to $15 cheaper than the valet. The pool area is a major let down to this hotel as you have exit the hotel and use the carpark lift to access it. If you dont want ot eat in the htoelthere are plent of restaraunt in the vacinity, just exit the hotel and turn right and then right again onto the main street, a number of good restaunts can be found a block to the left. The last thing is that this hotel adds 18% gratuity to ALL bills prior to receiving them. be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fik101
Reviews.Content: This has to be the perfect hotel for the business travel! It has everything you need. If you looking for the beach look elsewhere but its only a 15 minute ride to get to South Beach. The service is top notch. They go above and beyond to make it a great stay. The Rooms are very spacious with large bathroom and a great workstation to get your stuff done. My room had an Illy Expresso Machine that I used thoroughly 4-5 cups a day. The gym is great with the cold towels that help you cool off during your sweaty workout. Freeweights up to 50lbs, cardio machines, and excerise machines. They had yoga classes but my schedule did not allow me to participate in. My room was a city view so no ocean but no big deal. Everytime you wakeup here, you get your morning workout, have an expresso and look out the window. Its time to do business. Breakfast buffet was solid and great choices all the way around. Did not have the luxury of enjoying the pool but it had a great view. Its perfect for me to get my work done during the day, and the wife to spend all day all the pool, spa, and gym. Level 25 Bar has a lobster sandwich for $20.00 (Get it and worth it). Fantastic Mojito menu (10-Cane rum mojito... SImply the best) Emma was great! Valet is uber expensive at 45.00 a day. That was a tuff one to sallow but really have no choice. Fantastic hotel and I will be back. If youâ€™re here for business, no better place than the Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European hotel, incredible value”
Reviews.Author: mk14617
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe how cheap my reservation was at this hotel. I half expected cranes and construction upon my arrival. Instead, I found a fantastic and luxurious European hotel in a prime location. My room has million-dollar views of the bay and Miami Beach, and my Iffy espresso machine is the best I have ever seen in an American hotel. This was a business trip, and the hotel is in the Brickell business area (though a slew of great restaurants are within walking distance), but now I'm thinking of it for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “wrong part of miami for me”
Reviews.Author: carolsax
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton member abd love going to the Hilton so I chose this hotel for a two day stop off before catching a cruise at Fort Lauderdale. Should of checked out the location first as it was in the business area, which I knew, but too far from the beach and shops at Ocean Drive. Getting a cab was no problem but its just nice to walk out of your hotel and be on the door step of an amazing beach and loads of bars and restaurants. The staff in the Hilton were great. Helpful and professional. I upgraded my room which included free internet and breakfast. The breakfast was excellent; the choice was mind blowing. I dont know what size of room I would of been in if I had not upgraded but my room was ok, deffinately not spacious by american standards but I was happy. The bed was as comfortable, which you expect from Hilton. The drinks were pricey but you expect to pay over the odds in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Thunderstorm”
Reviews.Author: Basstringerfish
Reviews.Content: This stay completes at least two nights in every hotel style within the Hilton Hotel family. It was as advertised..slick. Chic. Sophisticated. Multi Cultural. It was also expensive! This was the one single best use of my Honors points and being a Diamond member since achieving the status! The arrival in the garage is very cool. Efficient and elegant. Go in the doors and to the left to the elevator up to the 25th floor and the doors open to a neat check in lobby area. It was an excellent check in for us. No delays. Room was ready upon arrival. The room was a suite on the 31st floor with a balcony and a kitchen. Full sized refrigerator that had a great ice maker, excellent coffee machine, dishwasher, etc. The room itself was very, very nice. Well decorated. Light airy, European to me. A full living room with a bar to eat and an seperate bedroom. It had a half bath and a full bath with a wonderful shower. The view on the balcony was decent. Would have been a bit disappointed if I had paid, but not enough to ruin the stay. We looked into a condo across the way, but to the right was the Bay and to the left was the city...we were fortunate enough to have a afternoon thunderstorm that was simply awesome. About 45 minutes of flash - boom. Right on top of us. Unbelieveable colors in the sky. A few things that I would like to see with the room: 1. there is only one trash can in the whole place and it was located under a table in the bedroom. Nothing in the bathroom, and nothing in the kitchen. It was very annoying to have to carry debris from the bathroom and kitchen to this little trash can in the bedroom. I did ask the wonderful staff for another and they brought me one, but why??? 2. The amenties in the bathrooms are great - for a woman. Trying to not sound sexist here, but the smell is a wonderful femine scent...not too manly! I live with my wife and 3 daughters so I just said what the hell, but I prefer the Peter Noth like in other Hiltons or even Marriotts Body Works..it seems to fit both men and women...3. No telephone in the front room...Ok...truth be told...only the trash can thing bothered me!!! Since we were going to be drinking at South Beach, we cabbed it from the hotel. Bellmen secured the cab...told them where to take us (Wet Willies on Ocean). The traffic Saturday was bad so the cost was about 30 - tip inclusive. Coming back it was 20 - tip inclusive. No problem for us getting a cab during the daytime from the beach. As an aside...South beach is expensive...18 bucks for a double gin and tonic...10 bucks for other drinks...do some asking around if this is prohibitive for you to get better deals...food was good though and at least we could taste the alchohol! OH and TIPS WERE INCLUDED EVERYWHERE WE WENT! Not sure if its city wide..just check the bill. I hate to bring expense up - but this was expensive - and I lived in Tokyo for 3 years! As a Diamond member we got the breakfast free - it was 60 bucks daily. Internet was free (not really sure of the charge, but had to have been at least 10 bucks)...Valet was a deal breaker for me..45 a night...highest i have ever paid...drinks were also pricy, but we expected that. For breakfast we were not aware that you can order omlets to made as part of breakfast until we were leaving after we finished our last day...you have to apparently ask. They ran out of eggs and sausage, but the wait staff worked very hard to make up for all this...and when they did get us sausage it was the best breakfast sausage I had... Could not eat in the restaurant because it was closed for a wedding. Not a fan of not advising a guest of this at check in. There was no other place to eat...Restaurant and Bar both closed...we walked to the Gordon Birsch and 75 bucks later walked out after having a couple burgers and a bottle of wine...you also can walk to two steak houses - one a Mortons. All over the internet there was talk of the Happy Hour at the bar on friday...great vibe, people, music, etc...get there to check it out after getting into the room...nothing. no more HH on Friday's. There were a LOT of foreign people (not all Hispanic) that made us feel like we were again ex pats in Tokyo. That was cool... Overall, the place was very cool. the staff was excellent. The room was good...location was fine. The food at the breakfast was very good...not worth the cost if we paid..Miami traffic is a pain. If you drive get there before or after rush hour. Not sure we return if we had to pay for it all though..It would have been almost 1300 just to pay for room, internet, food and drinks...NY Times on Sunday was very cool. I can see it being right between the Waldorf's we stayed at and the better higher end Hilton's. To be sure, there are worse places!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Week at The Conrad Miami”
Reviews.Author: teddyrex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from spending six nights at the Conrad Miami to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is extraordinary, particularly in the service area. We have stayed at Conrad hotels in Asia and Europe (see my reviews for Singapore, Hong Kong and Brussels) but never before in the USA where there are very few Conrad hotels and we wanted to see how this one compared. The major negative difference is that the Conrad Miami does not have a Concierge/VIP Lounge which is one of the outstanding features of the Asian (not Brussels) Conrad Hotels. However, as a Hilton HHonors Diamond member we were furnished an outstanding breakfast each morning with a choice of buffet, menu or even room service (which we did not use). I wrote the hotel before our arrival about my wife's birthday and thanks to Laura Padrino, VIP Relations Manager, and Sylvia Carrilo, Executive Assistant to the General Manager, we were greeted like visiting royalty. Noteworthy was the helpful welcome from the Front Desk, particularly Jenny who continued to provide outstanding service to us throughout our stay! The service throughout the hotel was impeccable - friendly and caring, yet very professional. The hotel is starkly modern, with an Asian feel to the decor. The rooms are quite large and most, if not all, appear to have gorgeous views of Biscayne Bay and the downtown Miami skyline seen through countless walls of glass (no balconies except a small one ajacent to the Atrio Restaurant on the 25th floor) All the usual amenities (fine linens, bath toiletries, turn-down service, etc) found in upscale hotels are present and at room rates which seem more reasonable than at other similar-type hotels nearby (Four Seasons, Mandarin, JW Marriott and several Ritz-Carltons). We ate one dinner at the hotel in the Atrio Restaurant which was excellent menu-wise and outstanding service-wise (Alicia was our server). Once we got accustomed to the rather odd layout (one set of elevators to lobby on 25th floor, another set of elevators to the guest rooms, and a third set to the swimming pool, tennis courts and spa on the roof-top of an adjacent building) we fell into the routine of navigating the hotel with no problems. The layout is explained to take maximum advantage of the outstanding views. In summary, the Conrad Miami is a wonderful hotel for a holiday get-away or a business visit to Miami. It is very conveniently located, valet parking is expensive but very prompt, and the Concierge service takes very good care of any transportation or local reservation needs. We thoroughly enjoyed our celebration stay and are already thinking of repeating this visit next year!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale yet overpriced”
Reviews.Author: slickrickATL
Reviews.Content: This place is very luxurious and the rooms are quite large. Very nice amenities including rooftop tennis courts and pool area. However, like all upscale properties, they nickel and dime you for everything. Snacks and beverages in the minibar are ridiculously priced (12oz Coke = $5.00). Valet parking is $41/day (after tax) and they are not exactly quick in retrieving your car. BEWARE THE $100 EARLY CHECK OUT FEE! We tried to check out 2-days early and spend the rest our trip to South Florida in Key West, no dice; Conrad will charge you $100 even if you leave before the standard checkout time. This is a beautiful property but they put making money over providing customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Waurawoo
Reviews.Content: Decor is wonderful! Clean and beutiful views! Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay, didn't like the elevator setup”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8Colorado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a day trip. Getting to South Beach was more expensive than we expected (took a cab for $35) but Vizcaya was a nice walk (about 20-30 min south). Along the walk was a park with huge spiders but high enough up in the trees to not bother the many joggers / bikers / walkers on the path. To get to the rooms from the ground floor, you have to take one elevator up to the 25th floor, get off and get on another set of elevators ... the guest rooms are floors 14-24 (there about) and then above floor 25 were residences. Floor 25 has the check-in, some seating and a restraurant with a couple of outdoor seats. Room was quiet, AC worked well and bed was comfortable. Also within walking distance of several restraurants and right across the street from the Brickell MetroMover stop. We used points for the stay and think overall its a good value for the amount of points we used.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmny
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Hilton's I have stayed at. The service was impeccable. Staff was courteous and very helpful. My room had great views of the Bay. Bar on 25fl is a great spot for a drink with excellent views of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “The Conrad has its ups and downs.”
Reviews.Author: copperpot
Reviews.Content: This was a relatively quick two day, one night stay in the Conrad for business. I spent a total of 24 hours in the hotel for meetings and did not go outside once. 15-20 minute drive to/from Miami International airport. $32 cab ride without tip. First, the staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. The service was spectacular. No problems at all with that aspect of my stay. We had three meals served by the hotel. There was kind of a cuban theme for dinner and lunch. It was mostly very good, and the food stands out because it was not the typical hotel fare. But it was still pretty good. Breakfast was fairly standard, which was great. Give me bacon, eggs, and waffles and I'm happy. My room on the 19th floor was showing its age. I included photos of the layout but did not get up close and personal with the problem areas. At some point in the past this was a very nice room. But now the woodwork is scraped and rubbed around the edges, the upholstery on the chair is worn and stained, and the lamp shades won't stay straight. The curtains and ceiling have dirt or marks here and there. It's not terrible, but noticeable. Regarding cleanliness: not too bad, but whoever was cleaning my room must have been shedding. Found three long black hairs in different places around the room. Two were in the bathroom, including one on the hand towel. The view of the water was nice. I could not see a beach anywhere close from my window view. There is a pool and a tennis court, probably because the building is also a residence, but I did not use them. Had a drink at the bar. It was fine and again, very good service. Nice little patio to feel the breeze. This is on the 25th floor so there is a decent view. About the weird layout. You pull up to the front and take the elevator to the lobby on the 25th floor to check in. This is the same elevator for the meeting rooms on 2 and 3. Your actual room for sleeping is avaliable only from a different elevator accessible only from the 25th floor. So I found myself getting on the elevator on 19, up to 25, get off, change elevators, and back down to 3rd for my meeting. Bizarre, but again it's not terrible. Just takes some getting used to. In the morning I could hear the neighbors on the other side of the wall getting up and about. Not a completely quiet experience. There is a business center where you can get on the internet and you can print things. Especially your boarding pass. I honestly don't know how much it costs because it was paid for by the people who hosted the meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: jfcovi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in August. I had a night in Miami on my way back from Turks and Caicos. This is a good hotel for a couple. The property has a very friendly staff and a bar with a nice rooftop view on Miami. I will definetely stay there again. Customer service is excellent. Good option for a stopover

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SandraCRS
Reviews.Content: I got a special rate through my travel agent in Brazil and I'm glad I chose it. Rooms are large and absolutely clean. Staff was well trained> Hotel is well located, close to the harbor and I-95. Although it is considered to be in downtown area, the neighborhood is quite residential and there are a handful of options on restaurants and bars. The only negative aspect is parking, once there are no public parking areas and valet prices are abusive.

Reviews.Title: “City getaway”
Reviews.Author: GrkKookla
Reviews.Content: This was a great staycation. Although the hotel is in the downtown area, it lets you feel like your staying in a luxury apartment. The pool is on a open deck where you don't feel like your in the city. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Brian M
Reviews.Content: I've literally traveled the world and must share that this hotel was the best hotel I have had the privilege to reside. Service- Prompt, Polite, Polished, Courteous, Out of the way helpful....I felt like I was a king! Food- Amazing! I went back to the hotel restaurant my last night because it was that good! Room- Clean, Comfortable, and Convenient.....reminded me of home

Reviews.Title: “Superficially great; down deep? Superficial”
Reviews.Author: CKesten
Reviews.Content: We chose the Conrad because we believed that it was a top of the line Hilton property. Our experience with Hilton's has generally been great previously (we stayed in the Hilton in Sandton, South Africa and never had a better experience) Unfortunately this wasn't the case with the Conrad. There was no concierge floor and virtually no benefits to being a Gold Hilton Honours member. When we checked in the front desk very reluctantly gave us two tickets for drinks in their restaurant/bar and let us know that we had been upgraded to a 'Bayview" room. We were on the 22nd floor and our upgrade was to a room right next to the elevator with a filthy carpet - but we could see water! Our next surprise was when we came to the bar that first night to use our drink tickets. The drinks were free but the automatic 18% gratuity (I must admit that they do write on your bill that the 18% can be adjusted - just tell the server to raise or lower it) based on the very high cost of the drinks was added onto the bill. We were staying at this property for 9 nights and we felt too awkward to tell the server to reduce the tip to a more reasonable level. Silly us - with a built in tip the service was rude, and just about non-existent. One evening we sat for close to 30 minutes waiting for someone to take our drink orders in a basically empty bar. And when we did get the drink it was slapped down on the table. As Hilton Gold we did get complimentary breakfast buffets and the food was quite good but the service was identical to the evening bar service. After a couple of days of tolerating this I finally went to the front desk to voice my concerns. There were many apologies. And the next day when we came back to the room after our afternoon jaunts there was a cheese plate waiting for us compliments of the manager with a note apologizing for our poor experience. The cheese plate had the same effect as the room upgrade - a great effort but poorly thought out - the cheese was delicious and tasty - and it left an odor in the room that we never really did get rid of - fortunately neither my wife nor I are lactose intolerant. The next morning breakfast was a different world - we were greeted by name, the waitress couldn't do enough for us, they found a Canadian supervisor and had him come over to chat us up - wonderful Wonderful that is until a few days later when the morning crew basically changed and the service and attitude went back to what seems to be normal in this hotel - rude and flippant. When anyone at the front desk recognized us we were asked how the stay was going and each time we related our experiences - good on some days and poor on others. Having stayed for an extended period and having such a poor experience I expected to have something happen at the front desk upon checkout - a free night, extra points - something, anything to indicate that the organization cared about our experience in their building. I was not surprised to find my bill intact and in fact with a mistake on it - somehow or other they mistakenly charged us for breakfast one day - strange in that every other day we stayed there the only charge for breakfast was that 18% gratuity of $8.64 on a complimentary breakfast! The Conrad looks beautiful, seems to be well designed and organized but that is all superficial - from the beautiful, thick, embroidered towels that simulate wax paper when you try to dry with them to the 25th floor bar balcony (filled with smokers) We'll look for another place to stay when we come back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice rooms...with a price to match”
Reviews.Author: MNetrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a business trip and got a pretty good rate to stay here in August 2011. The hotel is beautiful with extremely nice staff and customer service. The views of Biscayne Bay are great to see out of the window. The rooms are really comfortable with nice ammenities. Do be prepared for higher prices for room service and the restaurant/bar. There are many restaurants surrounding the hotel, but with the same price tags so it must just be the thing down there. A 22% gratiuity is added to all food charges, so you know. I'd stay at this hotel again due to the comfort and service...as long as the expense report isn't given too much grief.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August for a night and I have never experienced more attentive staff. The hotel is gorgeous and you can tell that they pay close attention to detail. Even though I arrived at 8am to the hotel, I was given a complimentary early check-in in no time. When it was time to leave I felt really sad that I was leaving the hotel and I promised myself that I would be back and I will! If you're planning on staying here make sure you bring dollar bills because you will be tipping a lot and check out the bathrooms at the lobby. They.are.awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff, will stay again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Elio R
Reviews.Content: Parking was a bit pricey but the staff is awsome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Conrad Miami”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night last Sep at this fabulous hotel at an incredibly nice rate of under $200 a night. New, fresh and fantastic room with huge windows for a lovely sea view. Service was superb. The only inconvenience was that the swimming pool is lcoated in an adjacent building - not a smart setup when guests in a bathrobe or swimming suit need to get down to the lobby and change elevators. Overall the service quality is unrivalled.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 20Alpha94
Reviews.Content: We went to Miami to celebrate a 40th birthday. We decided we wanted to be a good distance away from the hype of South beach and chose the Conrad. GREAT location! We were pleased that we were in walking distance to the Mary Brickell Village and just a bus ride away from Biscayne Bay. We were a bit disappointed that the cab ride to South Beach was so expensive. The room was roomy with clean lines and classy decor. The whole "lobby on the 15th floor" thing was a bit strange and you had to go to the adjoining building to access the roof top pool....huh? Who decided that was a good idea? But all in all, once you got used to the "go to the 15th floor and go around the corner to the other elevator bank to get to your room" thing, we had a great trip. It was good for the girlfriends but my husband would have been completely irritated by all that. Fantastic Spa!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like we should have been!”
Reviews.Author: daniel c
Reviews.Content: Great location and fantastic service. A very big thank you for making our long extended weekend getaway a success. Bed was comfortable, coffeemaker fantastic. I was not a coffee drinker now I am! Good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFun11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best that I have ever stayed at. My husband and I loved it and will definitely be coming back. The Service from the restaurant was not that great but the Concierge named " Alejandro" made up for it from the moment we stepped in the door to the moment we left our stay 2 days later. He was always courteous and helpful in every way, from giving us directions and setting up the best package tour available. As me and my husband walked in and out of the hotel several times a day he always smiled and greeted us. The view from our room was also very nice and the room very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingNurse2027
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using some points from my Hilton Honors card. I love to stay at the Hilton Hotels . I have stayed at many locations at this one was one of the best. I arrived really early in the morning at 630 am because I was on the red-eye and I was able to check in right away and get an upgraded room. The staff was very attentive and the place is beautiful with views of Biscayne Bay . Breakfast Buffet was wonderful and you had the option of sitting on the terrace to watch the view. The area the hotel is in is called Brickell and the restaurants around are plentiful. We were also able to walk to a street festival and it was enjoyable. I like Miami and the hotel up until the point of going to South Beach . Maybe I am too old for that kind of action but it made me sick to my stomach to see all the scantly clad women and people just showing off material things. You will get all your monies worth at the Conrad . I will definitely keep staying at Hilton Hotels. The only negative thing was no airport shuttle, hotel car or shuttle to cruise ship terminal other than that is was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: EastCost3
Reviews.Content: I started staying at the Conrad Miami @ 2 years ago and have been very satisfied with the hotel each time I have stayed. This last visit I traveled with business associates who have never stayed at the hotel. They stayed at the hotel on my recommendation. All were very satisfied with the accommodations, service, location and value. The views from the hotel's public spaces and rooms are incredible. Parking is expensive @$26 for self-parking, but is probably comparable to the other hotels on Brickell Avenue. We appreciated that the valet recommend the self-parking, instead of paying for the extra cost of the valet at late check-in. We ate a full breakfast every morning at a great deli across the Hotel's side street. It is also across the street from a Miami Metro station, which was very convenient when we didn't want to take the car to meetings, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Glass of Wine on the 25t hFloor”
Reviews.Author: WWHITE1967
Reviews.Content: About the fourth time here I think Room this time a little disappointing post complimentary upgrades, the things we all long for as a regular traveller. Hotel must be making a mark as no upgrades this time. Pleased for them as itâ€™s a nice clean hotel with attentive staff. Will stay here every time even though itâ€™s a way away from the nightlife

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: erin8424
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Miami on a leisurely weekend in June 2011. The hotel is fabulous down to every detail. The valet were very informative and gave directions to the lobby which is kind of tricky to locate. You must take the elevator to the 25th floor to the "sky lobby." Then once you check in, there are different elevators that go to the rooms (either above or below the 25th floor). There is a great bar with food and a patio overlooking the city and the bay which is breathtaking. The rooms are well furnished and very comfortable. Internet and parking are a little pricey but as is to be expected with boutique hotels. There is a roof top pool and tennis court on top of the parking garage that are very nice. Restaurants are within walking distance and we recommend Morton's Steakhouse for a more formal night or Gordon Biersch Brewery for a casual environment. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building in great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a very good stay. Brickell has really come to life as more than just the financial district. There is so much to do at night and lots of good places to eat. The hotel is in one of the nicest looking buildings on the strip. The service was very good. I'm a very low maintenance traveler and understand that with the amount of people using a hotel's facilities, there are going to be issues now and then. As long as the service is there to correct them, I'm a happy camper. After checking in, I noticed the phone next to the bed was not working so I called down and an engineer fixed the problem within 20 min. The room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. There were two large stains on the carpet by the door which looked like wine or grape juice and not anything disgusting that would really bother me. I did get a great rate on the Bay view room and although I got a good value, I can understand if somebody who paid a full price would want a little more â€œpopâ€� from the room. The furniture was simple and elegant and the room was spacious with a beautiful bathroom but the walls were pretty bare with only one small frame hanging between the double beds. The AC control seemed to not be calibrated correctly because the room always felt warmer than the temperature it was indicating. I just turned it to a cooler setting and was okay. One of the things that bugs me is people always complaining about high prices at hotels. I guess I just always expect them. It pains me to have to join the club though because I was really taken aback two times during the stay. First, upon arriving I asked what the rate was for guest parking and the valet attendant told me it was $36 per day. I then asked about self parking and that was $26 per day. Luckily, the manager overheard the conversation and noticed my car and informed me that there was free accessible parking (I have a permit) right around the corner which we used the entire stay. Again, great service by the bell staff who were excellent every single day. My second and main issue was room service. On the first night, I was going to go out but wanted to grab a quick bite before leaving since I was traveling all day and had not eaten. We ordered a hamburger and club sandwich two glasses of juice and a Coke. After all was said and done including service charges, delivery charge, and tip, my bill was $81. Again, this was for a burger and sandwich. I have never once complained about high food prices at hotels but this one was just more than I ever expected. At least it made for great conversation the next couple of nights. Yes, the people who say at the Conrad in Miami can afford all these prices but it doesn't mean we enjoy overpaying for things. The food was good however. I had breakfast every day at Deli Lane across the street from the hotel and it was very good. On the bright side, I was given a free drink coupon at check in redeemable at the atrium lobby bar which was nicely decorated and had a great view. Drinks here were about $15 which is about what I expect at a hotel and especially the nicer ones like these. The view from here was perfect for watching the 4th of July fireworks! Check-in and checkout were smooth as can be and only took about 2 min. each. The only issue I can really find with service (and it didn't bother me one bit) was that I was offered a free paper at check in which I took only because it was offered free, but it never arrived. No worries since I never read the paper anyways. I know we tend to remember and write down the negative things we encounter just because it's easier but believe me, this is a very good hotel. I would definitely recommend it and would stay again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Down on One Knee Package provides Perfect Romantic Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: archdent
Reviews.Content: While looking for a "package" for a romantic get-away to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary we discovered the "Down on One Knee" package. The package included champage flutes from Tiffany with our initials engraved on them, chocolate covered strawberries with champage (in our room on arrival), round trip transfers from the Miami International Airport in their beautiful Audi 8, "set" menu dinner in the Atrio Restaurant with wine pairings, complete American breakfast in the room, couples massage and all of the amenities that come with staying in the Conrad genre of facilities. The service and facility are impeccable. We were upgraded to a king suite with a partial view of the bay and beautiful city views. They brought us a telescope so that we could hone in on the sites throughout the city. We visited the pool and utilized the "free" cabanas. They have this wonderful lotion poolside that you can use after you swim and the pool towels are the softest I have ever felt. The fitness center is open 24 hours and is more than adequate - plus it is on the spa level, so you have the locker room and the dry heat as well. There are many things to do within a walk or MetroMover/MetroRail ride from the hotel. We were there on a holiday weekend, so the schedules were not as frequent as during the regular days and weekends. You can, however, walk to Mary Brickell Village (901 South Miami Avenue- 4 blocks north and two blocks west), which has wonderful restaurants and shops-including a Publix grocery store to pick up snacks and necessities. (check hours). There is a really nice coffee machine in the room and there is no charge, but they don't really tell you that. If in doubt in this hotel, just ask. They will answer any question or accomodate any request. If you don't like the answer you get, just go over that person's head and you will probably get what you want. They really are there to please the guests. As a seasoned traveler, I have to say that this is probably one of the best two hotels that I have ever stayed in (it is in contention with the Blackberry Farm in Walland, Tennessee for No. 1). The staff here remembers your name (it's kinda freaky). The only negative that I could possibly think of is that the scrambled eggs were not up to par with my moms. Everything else was absolutely perfect. The staff is professional, discreet, yet friendly and not "stiff". A special shout out to Francois the limo driver who is amazing and Alejandro, who is a FIU Hospitality student interning at the hotel (a real asset). Natalia, the marketing manager, is also on top of everything from making sure that everything gets done when it is supposed to. Thanks to everyone at the hotel for the perfect staycation. J & A

Reviews.Title: “important!”
Reviews.Author: sylvia__star
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Miami and I stayed at the CONRAD hotel. It was a wonderful possitive experiane and I loved every minute at the hotel :))

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: COSouthpaw
Reviews.Content: My wfie and I stayed here using our points due to a flight layover. Hotel is in financial/downtown district. Very clean, modern and well appointed. One tip I can recommend is the following: hold off on going to hotel bar for about an hour or so upon arrival. We did not do this and spent a fair amount on pricey drinks. When we returned to room, two free drink coupons were in an envelope that was slid under door. Not a huge thing, but coupons had $30 value.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know Miami had a Financial District!”
Reviews.Author: livs2eat
Reviews.Content: When I think Miami, I think 'South Beach' or "just" beach or Mojitos but not - 'Financial District' so color me pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Conrad. Beautiful property, great room (mine was TINY) but elegant and super clean (a must for a germaphobe like myself). We found a cool little shop and restaurant district within walking distance where we had a drink and watched people and their cars for a bit. Folks in Miami should really claim Texas as home - they like things BIG. BIG watches, BIG cars, BIG (as in "notice me") wheels. Actually we were both amazed and amused by the variety of wheels we saw while people watching... Anywho, we decided to have dinner at the Conrad and were thrilled with our meal. The host told us we should have 'called ahead' but trust me, we basically had the room to ourselves... Our server, Alana, was wonderful and the food could not have been better. Skip dessert and eat more veggies, the succotash was yummerroo!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business or Pleasure - Sleek, Sophisticated, boutique style.”
Reviews.Author: mgtopagent
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exceeded our expectations. I accompanied my husband on a professional event he was attending at the hotel. Rooms are sleek, great housekeeping, luxurious towels, impressive marble bath with tub and great shower. My only complaint is that there is really nowhere to put anything in the bathroom (many new hotels seem to have this issue). The Conrad actually occupies about four floors in a larger ultra-modern office/condo building. Lobby is on the 25th floor, concierge is on the 1st floor (they are great, by the way, as is all of the staff), and you have to go down from the 25th floor to get to your room. Great air-conditioning, quiet very large room most with some views of stunning Biscayne Bay. You will enjoy the cocktail lounge - outdoors on 25th floor with great views and lovely Atrio restaurant where we had breakfast. There are easy options for walking, dining, and transportation. I drove my car to nearby Coral Gables one day (about 15 minutes, for beautiful outdoor, upscale shopping) - Concierge provided map and brochure for Merrick village (sp?). Short ride into Miami Beach and South Beach area also. They have a quiet roof-top pool that is attractive (was not manned and no food or bar service while I was there) that was relaxing for an afternoon I spent there. We drove to another four diamond Waldorf Astoria in Key West when we left the Conrad - the Casa Marina Resort. However, that room, even allowing for the fact that it is an older historical property - does not measure up to the housekeeping and sparkling, updated and beautiful decor of the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Cute Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atavistic8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Miami for business for 4 days. When I arrived at the hotel, the service at the bellman desk was outstanding. I had several boxes for work and they graciously took 2 carts of boxes and suitcases upstairs to the 25 floor where the check-in reservation desk is located. I had to wait a few hours for the rooms to be available so the front desk offered to keep my boxes stored in their office while I went to lunch. The front desk also offered me a free drink ticket to be used at the restaurant or pool bar. That was a nice gesture. They provided me with a map of the area and several restaurants for me to chose from while I waited for the room to be ready. When it was raining outside, the bellman offered me an umbrella to take with me to my destination. I have never experienced that at a hotel. Nice gesture. When I went to the pool for a break, the pool attendant/bartender was very very pleasant. There wasn't many people using the pool, which is beautiful. The pool is located on top the parking deck but the cabanas are free and there are plenty of chairs to lay out in. You don't normally fine free cabanas in miami. Again, this was a very nice gesture!! The one thing I didn't like was the breakfast at the hotel. I ordered fresh eggs special. But, they gave me liquid eggs scrambled. I wasn't feeling that for the 14.00 breakfast cost. Other than that, the rooms were modern and the bathroom had a seperate shower and tub with marble around the bathroom. They had direct tv with lots of channels. The main point is that the service at this hotel is outstanding. Many hotels could use a lesson in service from the Conrad Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Shower was amazing”
Reviews.Author: TheDebsters
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was excellent! It is the little things that can make or break a stay; the staff were eager to help and very friendly. The shower was wonderful, with thick bath sheets in the room. Any problems - a member of staff saw to the issue immediately. I would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Conrad Miami”
Reviews.Author: ozpix
Reviews.Content: This was our fist visit to Miami. We arrived at the hotel late at night & were instantly impressed with the look, feel & customer service of the hotel. The hotel looked very modern, funky & sleek & our room proved to be very comfortable & met our needs well. There was free wifi in the reception area & we also made use of the really cool looking rooftop pool which was built above the hotels carpark. We walked the nearby streets & that part of the city looked very clean & neat & felt very safe! It was also convenient for us as it was only a 5 min drive away to the cruise port of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, classy, and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Retuta
Reviews.Content: Myself and three girl friends flew to miami for leisure. We are all in our mid twenties and were looking to have some fun. I was really impressed with this hotel from the get go. Downtown Miami was not only clean and safe, there were no bums hanging out near the premises which you normally see elsewhere. I'm from LA so it's typical. Although the location was 10 mins away from South Beach, downtown Miami wasnt bad at all. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. I booked a one bedroom with twin beds. We were kind of surprise by how small the beds where, but we did get the hotel at a resonable price. We wanted to save our money for all the partying and drinks. The consierege was super helpful as well. We wanted to rent a car for our last day so we could drive to Key West. When I called enterprise and hertz, they weren't very helpful at all. So we decided to call the front desk, they said they would handle it for us. We ended up getting a jeep wrangler for a reasonable price and it was already waiting for us that morning. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were amazing as well. I definately reccommend this hotel for anybody as well as people on a budget. It's about $20 for a cab ride to South Beach. Also, check out Blue Martini which is a few blocks from the hotel. They have a live band and the bartenders were super nice. We also managed to walk back to the hotel safely.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit To Miami”
Reviews.Author: MarilynBB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights before a cruise and enjoyed it immensely. The location is great with good restaurants for the times we didn't want to eat in the hotel, access to public transit is good and highway access is easy. Staff are helpful and friendly. Love to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: ChefMairaIsabel
Reviews.Content: This hotels is the ultimate best in customer service. This is the 2nd time I've stay here and I cant wait to go back. They will do what ever it takes to make sure you are comfortable and feel at home. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world, but the Conrad is by far the best of the best!.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, view of beaches and ammenities at this premier hotel”
Reviews.Author: hayzeus29
Reviews.Content: Staff had an incredible service oriented attitude and addressed every special request to my satisfaction. Hotel accommodated a very early check-in outside of industry norms. Not unlike my experience at a few other Hilton Hotels, management has sourced and groomed their staff well!! In spite of the size of this high-rise, only six floors, seventeenth through twenty-first floor are dedicated to hotel rooms. Hence, every room has a great view. Moreover, you'll never experience long lines at front desk characteristic of the mega-hotels! You'll love the Bay view from the outdoor seating adjacent to bar, breakfast area and restaurant - located on lobby level on twenty-fifth floor. Pedestrian friendly - located across the street from Metro Loop Station - 14th Street Metro Loop Station - Brickell Line!! Caution: Hotel room Espresso Machine may be addictive. Jesus Brito

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine0187
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Miami is stunning. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable, spacious and elegantly decorated. The view of the ocean out of the huge floor-to-ceiling window was stunning. The shower was wonderful and the bathroom was spotless. The bathroom had a real spa-feel to it. The bar with the terrace overlooking the ocean is definately worth a visit, and the cocktails on offer here are delicious!!! The staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming and couldn't do enough for you. The hotel isn't cheap, but the service and facilities you are paying for are truly outstanding. The only thing to be careful of is the car parking fee, it was $26 a night so its best to really think about whether you actually need a car or not (unlike us, we parked our car in the underground car park and didn't use it during our stay at all - not the best idea at $26 a night!) I would love to go back to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Hilton just wow!”
Reviews.Author: SSfamily
Reviews.Content: A unique hotel great for business and I could see vacation there as well. Great rooms, service and food. A deal any way you look t it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable Property”
Reviews.Author: egermata
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend and I loved the place. It was my first time in Miami visiting from Chicago. Everyone I interacted with was so nice and friendly. Denise checked us in and she was very informative about the property. We missed the bus to our Everglades tour (miscommunication between us and the tour group), and the concierge (Francois?) was very helpful and was able to get in contact with the company and we took a cab to meet at one of their next stops. One of the female concierges (M-something) was very helpful explaining the area including the Metro Mover and the buses to get to the bay area and the beaches. It really wasn't that difficult to get around from the hotel either with public transit or just taking a cab ride. I think I liked it better that I wasn't staying in the South Beach craziness. We had a nice corner room on the 21st (I think) floor. The room was nicely laid out and actually very spacious (especially the bathroom). I loved the pool area too. It's nice that it was open till 10pm and the deep end was close to 5' instead of like 3 feet like I've seen at many "deep ends" (greatly appreciated when you're 6'4!). The little terrace area off the bar had great views. We did a breakfast pre-order and it was delicious! The elevator to the lobby and then to the room didn't really annoy me that much as some of the other reviews mention. Getting to the pool was kind of annoying though, but I may have been going the wrong way! This was my first actual stay at a Conrad, but I'm very familiar with the Conrad Chicago and also checked out the one in San Juan last year. It's a great brand!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: smagwood
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel after returning from a cruise. We heard great things about the hotel so we decided to stay. The bell service was excellent and we had a great view unfortunately the room was horrible. The room needed to be painted badly - scuff marks everywhere and the carpet had several stains. Not at all what we expected for a 4 star hotel that was a little over $300 a night. We asked to be moved to another room and the response was "We are sold out." I'm sure we will not be returning to another Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “great location to attend the sony ericsson tournament”
Reviews.Author: camarotte
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Miami at the Brickell area of Miami in order to see the Sony Ericsson Tennis tournament in the las week of march/2011 , and I was satisfied with the hotel... Some points could be improved , like breakfast for example.... for U$ 30 per person , I expected a little bit more... The up and down with the lift to reach the pool and the health club can be annoying too.. although not much... Wifi internet was free in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous luxury hotel with modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: tpa2eurotravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here many occasions and it has been consistent each and every time. The hotel is very clean and modern, the lobby is located on the 25th floor and was cool to enter from there and go down to our room. The hotel has a very upscale feel and the restaurants are delicious and overpriced. We were welcomed warmly each time. it is a bit off path from miami beach but definitely worth it. It's optimal for business stays and pleasure stays as well. we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: This is one of many reviews I completed over the years. Never have I said a hotel is perfect. I simply have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. The staff is wonderful, the rooms elegant, and the restaurant excellent. If you are looking for a pool you will have a walk as it is a bit inconvenient. Good job with this one Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in Downtown Miami”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Conrad Miami in downtown Miami to attend the Sony Ericsson Tennis Open in March 2011. The hotel is quite lovely, but a little confusing at first. There is a lobby on the ground floor, but there's only a concierge desk. The check in and real "lobby" is on the 25th floor. When I got there, attendants escorted me up to the 25th floor and a really nice desk attendant checked me in. I'd say that overall, the service experience is excellent. I was given, what I assume, was a run of the house room on the 21st floor. The room was large, spacious, and modern. The bathroom was as big as any bathroom I've ever seen with both a tub and a shower. The bed was so comfortable. There is also complimentary internet access, which is huge (at least for me). Located in downtown Miami, there wasn't a lot to do in the immediate area and it sort of cleared out (I assume because I was never there at the time) at the end of the work day. There are a couple of restaurants, including a Capital Grille and Gordon Biersch in the area. I usually like to work out when I'm on travel and the fitness room, located on the 24th floor, was adequate, with some stationary bikes, treadmills, and a couple of elliptical trainers. There were also some exercise balls and dumbbells. One of the most non-sensical things about the Conrad is the need to go to the 25th floor lobby to transit between your room and the ground floor. You'll need to get to the 25th floor via the guest room elevator then walk around the corner to the lobby to catch another elevator to get to the ground level. Overall, I think the Conrad Miami is a modern, chic hotel and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Guiv37
Reviews.Content: Conrad Hotel has excelent amenities, anyway I've been there two times last month, and in both oportunities the ckeck inn was two hours late. I arrived soon, and they promissed to send me an email as soon as the room would be ready, but they forgot it. The freedge was broken, I complain about it, but nobody fix it, so it was broken for the five days I was lodge. Terrible.In the day I was leavind, I payed for late check you, it supose to be 4 o'clock, and at 4:05 the housekeaping was kno king desperately to leave the room. The houseking was very unpolite, so I had to wait two hours for check inn and they couldn't wait ten minutes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: pedroschmidt
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Conrad Miami. Nice and clean rooms, the reason why we stayed here was mainly for its double suite room, with kitchen and two bathrooms. The staff was amazingly helpful, even arranging an early check-in at 6:00 AM. The location is excellent, right in the heart of Downtown Miami, at Brickell.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sbendpassport
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Miami for the first time-when we checked in, the friendly clerk offered a free upgrade. My! What an upgrade! It was a one bedroom "residence" which means a full kitchen, sitting area, patio overlooking the bay, very large bathroom, etc. We didn't want to leave!
