I enjoyed a spa treatment with Alejandra -she was very attentive and made sure I was completely satisfied. We loved the location of the hotel due to the free metromover right across the street and the Brickell Village shops & restaurants just a few blocks away. Other than a trip to South Beach, we never saw our car again. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “A sticky start but ended well”
Reviews.Author: janeySwEngland
Reviews.Content: In the Financial District by the sea, a very swish hotel. Check-in was messed up, we waited over 4 hours for our 2nd room. The Duty Manager put things right by offering us all late check out (6pm). This suited our needs exactly. It has a beautiful (heated) pool area,food available, spacious luxurious rooms, the breakfast was great too. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very swank”
Reviews.Author: CurvyDivaLady
Reviews.Content: I was a little worries at first because of the location but once you're inside it's a whole new world. They made me feel like a princess. The elevator switching was confusing at first but became very similar over time. It was luxury service from the valet to room service. They even brought the ice by request. They answers your every beck and call which I suggest u keep cash at hand for tipping. Our bags were brought to our room for us and things were hung and laid out. I loved it. My only little complaint were that all of the light fixtures didn't work. I had their interpretation of a king size bed, I felt the bathroom was bigger than the sleeping space but still two thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shadimart
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the conrad for a week, the hotel was very clean rooms were big enough for the two of us, i heard from other reviews that there was no coffie machine or the tv was old, well our room had a coffie machine and a big plasma, and i paid for the normal room. if you don't want to rent a car here are some tips to go around miami: the hotel is in down town miami so there is not a lot of stuff to do around the hotel, but there is a metromover station just acroos the street that you can use (FREE) to go aroune the center of miami you can go to bayside market where you can find a lot of resturants, ( chills, hooters, hardrock cafe, the knife....) i liked the kinife wich is an argentnian steakhouse type buffet where you can have lunch for 20$ bottle of wine& dessert included and dinner for 26 $, they have a great slad bar . if you want to go to south beach you can take a taxi that will cost you about 25$, or if you have time you can take a bus just in front of bayside you have to take the S line it will cost 2$ per person,and will take you abou 30 min ,you can go down at alton st. and lincoln, where you will walk through lincoln shopping strreet where you can find alot of resturants and shops, i realy love sushi so i went to this place it,s called DORAKU it was really great sushi, it will cost you for 2 person about 60$ try the tuna and avocado salad really great .

Reviews.Title: “parking sucks”
Reviews.Author: parkvilledoc
Reviews.Content: we arrived in our rental car, a Ford Focus. As we pulled in to check out our parking options, a valet dude yells at me to move my car so that a hummer limosine can come in. It's not like the hummer didn't have the room. i parked and waited for valet and this mofo starts to complain to me that i can't leave my car there cuz other car (the limosine) can't get in. it's after that we told the dude that we were gonna valet park that he finally shut up. it costs 37$ plust tax and some other BS charge that actually comes out to 50$ a day. Room and Bathroom is actually nice. Had hard time sleeping when rain fell cuz rain drops hitting on the metal frame of the building made large ringing noises. getting in a out of building is a little hassle. over all good experience but boy parking dudes, unless u drive in there with a tux and minimum of bmw, hew, man, never felt so ignored with a rental car before. well but than i was wearing hoodie, shorts, and a running shoe. guess valet parkers thought we didn't belong there huh. other than that we had no problem getting our cars in and out of valet. only problem, if u tip them everytime u pull ur car out i think it can get well over 50$ a day. oh yeah, i was double charged on the last day, which was solve w/out incident. If i didn't look over charges, i probably paid that extra charge. i don't know, maybe they like to sneak one in there hey. maybe i'm complaining because i've never had to pay that much for a parking in a hotel like this. so if u r an average Joe wanting to experience "4 star" hotel, this may not be ur best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Stan1245
Reviews.Content: Absolute tops. We spent two days in Conrad Hilton Miami for holiday and loved it very much. Hotelrooms are great, and staff very friendly. On the minor points: the parking charge of $37/day is high and if you are looking for miami-beach fun, that is still some way off. But generally we would advise this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, leisure - not so sure”
Reviews.Author: goshan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for business purposes, and everything was great. The room was big, bathroom was spacious. I was upgraded to a Bay view which was very nice. However, if you are staying here for leisure, downtown area is just empty, and you would have to go to other areas (South Beach, etc.) to get some fun. Other than the location, this is a great hotel (and a bit expensive, I might add).

Reviews.Title: “frieidly staff,...overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rooborne
Reviews.Content: Cordail staff , Room amenities are fine retaurant NOW THE FUN BEGINS.... $214 is the csotL FOR 2 NIGHTS PARKING AND breakfastFOR 2.. Add $400 for 2 dinners for 2 2 NIGHT stay at $300 / night final cost $1284.00 including tax

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Good Option for Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here before a work training. With our office just a block away, it was a great stay, but there's not much around so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for leisure stays. I got a good deal so for the price, I thought it was great value. The hotel is a bit odd as the lobby is on the 25th floor, but immediately when you get out of there are multiple people to tell you exactly where to go and walking through the lobby, everyone is very friendly. Up on the 25th floor, I was checked in immediately, given a little tour and put in the elevator to get to my room. The room view was great, it faced the bay which was stunning. The room wasn't very big, which was odd as the bathroom was huge but the space wasn't used very well. There is a nice shower, very low tub and then a really small sink area with so many little things already on the counter that it was impossible to fit my own toilettries. The bed was comfortable, but again, felt it wasn't balanced very well in combination with the oddly large bathroom. I ordered room service, the restaurant looked good and they had the full menu for room service, but for the price, the portion was pretty small. It was pretty good though. The cheese plate on the otherhand, just $8, was massive, I could barely finish it! The food was brought quickly and the service was excellent. Internet was $15 which seems high for a business hotel, but I'm not really up on how much others are charging, I rarely bring my computers. If I need to visit my Miami office again, I'll definitely stay here, especially if I get a similar deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Outside of South Beach”
Reviews.Author: illchick
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Conrad in November for a spa weekend with a friend and it was fantastic! Upon arriving, we found out that they had us for a king instead of a double and Carlos upgraded us to a two bedroom residence. The room was on the floor below that top and had a fabulous view and had all the comforts of home. The spa had a fantastic package for pumpkin facial and massage, which left me feeling like butter. Everyone from the valet to the concierge was incredibly helpful. Even though the hotel if off the beaten path, it truly is top notch. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice of stay to celebrate my wife's 40TH Birthday”
Reviews.Author: iflygary
Reviews.Content: My wife was looking for something really special for her 40th birthday. We went back and forth between a weekend getaway alone, just the two of us without the kids, or a birthday party. Finally, she decided that some alone time would be just the thing we needed. Being from the Tampa Bay area, we thought a nice weekend in Miami would be the pefect place to spend the weekend. I chose the Conrad Miami based upon reading prior reviews. Let me tell you, I was elated I did! What a beautiful hotel!! The rooms are gorgeous! The hotel was fabulous!. And finally, the staff and service are top-notced. Our stay began with our room being upgraded and no charge. Denise checked us in and was so professional and courteous and also walked us to the elevator and said she would be availabe throughout our weekend stay. Every staff member greeted us with a smile and was so eager to assist us. George who was one of the bellmen, was also a pleasure to talk to and very helpful in suggesting places to see and things to do while in the Miami area. The location of the hotel being downtown and located just off of Biscayne Bay was also centrally located to all of the main Miami attractions. This hotel was definitely the right choice to make! When visiting Miami again, there is no doubt this will be the place we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “New tv's at a hampton or homewood”
Reviews.Author: oskiwow
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe that a top flight hotel still has crappy tv's in guest rooms. Especially, given that this is in the hilton family and all the other down stream properties have upgraded in room equipment. The coffee in the restaurant is surprising blah and crappy since the property is in Miami and there are numerous local coffee sources. This is still a beautiful property, but it sure could use a little TLC. I will likely look to the intercontinental or other property for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area and equipment but extremely noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Epigone
Reviews.Content: Hotel settings are perfect in Miami business district. Staff is extremely helpful, overall hotel equipment is perfect. THE big issue is noise. Form outside first, as rooms overlook a king of helicopter like machine producing air conditioning. You basically have the impression to sleep in front of an airport. From inside first, as doors are extremely thin, and any person chatting in the corridor seems to talk to you in your bed. If you first expect to sleep when you are in an hotel, do not go there...

Reviews.Title: “Conrad”
Reviews.Author: 1TrippyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room I had was decent. It smelled somewhat moldy initialy but seem to be fine after a while. The rooms are not sound proof. The bathrooms were huge. Great view of the city or Biscayne Bay. You have to take an elevator to the 25th floor to get to the front desk and then you have to take another elevator to get to your room. You have to go to the 25th floor to get to and from your room. Parking at this hotel will run you about $37 a day if you use valet parking. The area that surrounds the Conrad has lots of restaurants, shops, and bars. It's in the Miami financial district, so everything seems to be a little pricey. The service at teh hotel was very good. It's about 15 minutes from South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RIBluebird
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Conrad Hotel. We only wish it was longer and that we hadn't gotten in so late. The American Express deal that we got was an amazing value. We would highly recommend staying here and would definately stay there again. We almost extended our vacation by a day just to stay another night and spend some time relaxing on the property and at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: dpogi
Reviews.Content: Conrad Miami is a great choice for hotel and is close to great restaurant choices and convenient to Miami Beach, the AA Arena and other Miami entertainment. If you covet a little more quiet evenings yet close to the action, the Conrad Miami is a great choice

Reviews.Title: “A typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandralves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown, very central. The bed is very confortable, but the rooms are too small. The breakfast is very poor, with only a few options (they don't even have bagels!) to eat in the morning. The views from Front Desk is wonderful and the staff is really nice. The valet service and the concierge are also great.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FIRST CLASS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Fortausan
Reviews.Content: Checked in at midnight. Had requested non-smoking room. When I checked in, the front desk said nothing. When I got to room and realized it was smoking, was told nothing could be done. For a non-smoker, spending ANY time in a smoking atmosphere is HORRIBLY SICKENING. It is COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE. Can't sleep. Eyes burn. Clothes smell for REST OF TRIP. More unacceptable, is that I was not informed. That is DECEPTIVE. And if that wasn't bad enough, the mini-bar was COMPLETELY EMPTY. Will NEVER stay at this hotel or ANY CONRAD HILTON EVER AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “COOL HOTEL WITH 5 STAR SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CWT_Chris
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 02nights on business, and I have to say I was blown away with the hotel, the staff, the service, the food!! All of which was second to none! The staff were very very attentive, and nothing was too much trouble. I would have to give special thanks to Adriana Campos who made our stay throughly enjoyable with her professionalism and courteous manner, and also to Alana, who never failed to ensure that our glasses were always topped!! :0) Rooms were gorgeous, and I would recommend asking for a bay view ... the sunrise is stunning to watch!! The Bathrooms are HUGE and luxorious, and I was tempted to sleep in them rather than the bedroom ... but that is of no disrespect to the bedroom. Big, comfrotable King bed made for a good nights sleep, (after enjoying the Miami nightlife of course!!). All in all a very very nice hotel!!! I would have no problem in recommeding it to anyone! Good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Our best choice”
Reviews.Author: Vienna76
Reviews.Content: I had a happy time stayed at this attractive hotel. Stayed 3 nights throughout the our holiday. This is a large hotel - front table, outside and well being association staff were amicable and professional. The a atrium petition is stunning and a large location to sit, rest and have a late after noon cocktail. Accommodations were magnificent - complicated muted decor with fine furniture and a large bathing room with distinct walk-in shower. I have stayed at the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton South Beach, Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove more...and my accommodations at the Conrad were far better to any of the others. I will decisively be back. I have read remarks about being in a enterprise locality but there are large bistros inside strolling expanse of the hotel and is a protected locality for jogging and strolling along the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted a special vacation, Conrad made it...”
Reviews.Author: KaustuvDG
Reviews.Content: Wanted a special vacation, Conrad made it happen again. Began with a complimentary upgrade to a suite. Service is impeccable - attention to detail makes everything a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckgosch
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here between our wedding in Key West and our flight out for our Honeymoon. Hotel was absolutley beautiful, we were in a corner suite with amazing views of the water and the skyline. The room was huge and very well appointed. The bed was very comfortable, and the shower/batheroom was great. We were tired and decided to just have dinner in the Hotel restaurant and were very impressed, food was wonderful as was the service. The lobby bar has a great balcony for looking out on the water. We had breakfast in the room, which was equally good. Hotel is in a great location, and staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Valet and Check for Hair in Towels”
Reviews.Author: tblovinlife08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on vacation for one night. We decided to splurge a bit and were very excited to stay here. Check in went fine, but the front desk agent did not tell us anything about the hotel. We also noticed hair in our towels in the bathroom. After dropping off my car at the valet stand one night, we walked around the hotel to go to dinner and I saw the valet driving my car like a maniac. I used to be a valet, so I understand the concept, but he was driving it harder than I ever have. I complained at check out and the front desk agent did take off the charge ($32). I also mentioned it to the bell captain and he laughed it off saying that I had a fast car (VW GTI!) Stay somewhere else in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Cool Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rose078
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with spouse and toddler daughter for a business / leisure combo. The hotel condition and decor are very new, modern and hip. Wonderful service. Friendly, yet sophisticated atmosphere. Super clean. I loved that our two room suite was comfortable and spacious... plenty of running around with a little one at bay. The pool area is not huge but it is beautiful and the pool service was really nice, ordered drinks and the attendant even got me fruitcups which wasnt on the menu, so thanks for that. Another perk I appreciated was a little kiddy corner at the pool area with a pack n play, noodles, tubes and toys that I took advantage of. Overall, a very chic hotel, had a great stay and will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gio0700
Reviews.Content: In a few words I love this hotel. I love the complete experience I received in the hotel. The staff is amazing and Kevin Cordoniu is the most professional person I have dealt with in a long time. He treat us like kings and made the right decesions for us to have a memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: aqua2008
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Conrad while where were in town for a concert and some general sight seeing. We are very used to Hilton properties and the Conrad met and exceeded our expectations. First class all the way. The layout is unique with the 25th floor sky lobby, the views make up for any confusion. Location is business district but there are several bars/restaurants within walking distance and were very lively even on the weekend. Also across the street is a metro stop that is free of charge and can take you around the downtown area. We had a rental car and the valet seemed to be priced in line with major US cities. Service was fabulous all the way. They even helped us track down tickets to events in South Beach that we wanted to attend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: AA0211
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one of our sales meets. The hotel is about a 20 mins taxi ride from Miami international airport. There is no hotel shuttle available. Taxi charges between $25-$30. One odd thing I found is that the reception is on the 25th floor and there are 2 sets of elevators to go to various floors. One takes you only to the rooms and the other to the street level and meetings rooms etc. Confusing. I guess it is because the hotel is located on certain floors in a commercial building. The breakfast does not have a very wide spread and is quite expensive for the variety provided. Did not have lunch or dinner at this restaurant. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. Lots of storage area and Wi-fi + wired internet was available. There is a great view of the water-bodies from some rooms. I was fortunate to have one of them. The reception staff are extremely friendly and wil guide you when required (especially the elevators !!). None of the beaches are near-by so taxi is the best way to get there. About $20 to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “$20,000 worth of gold/diamonds TAKEN!”
Reviews.Author: niketa12
Reviews.Content: So this was a start to what i thought a perfect vacation... We checked into our room about 2:30pm. We went up to use the rr and put away our gold as i just got it from my mother in georgia. We were about to go to the beach so i figured it would be safe in my room for 3 days and the safe had a lock...well i locked it in the safe used the rr and left for the beach. When we came back to the room later that evening i found the toilet paper re rolled up and perfected...a bit confused i mentioned it to my husband that someone may have come in to the room after we checked in and we both flogged it off as nothing and just a housekeeper. Never in a million years did we think someone would have taken our stuff out of the safe in our room. The bell man was to bring out stuff up to the room well thats what we thought. We checked out 3 days later and found that nothing was in the safe...frantically i went to the front desk and they said ohh its here dont worry oh we understand blah blahhh- Amanda the manager came out and spoke with me trying to be sympathetic with me but i didnt work..can you imagine losing your wedding gifts priced over $20,000.00 NO! i was going crazy crying my eyes out...finally she made the security guy come and make me fill out a incident report and basically thhey wanted me to fill it out and they thought it would be all over. Well after much yelling i finally filled it out and gave it back..they were looking at me like i was crazy. my flight was in 2 hours so i had to get going. Finally we left and were at the airport only to get delayed.. i then recieved a phone call from Frank stating that they couldnt get the police involved as i was no longer at the property. I yet again was upset!...aBOUT 15 MINS before my flight was taking off Frank called me back stating he found the stuff and that i would have to pay for the stuff to be shipped to me. I IMMEDIATELY got pissed off and yelled at him that i was not going to pay for it..come to find out FRONT DESK NEVER COMMUNICATED WITH HOUSEKEEPING THAT THE ROOM HAD BEEN RE-RENTED TO SOMEONE ELSE- SO SHE CALLED SECURITY THINKING THE ITEMS IN THE SAFE BELONGED TO THE PREVIOUS GUESTS SO THEY TOOK IT!!! WITHOUT LOOKING TO SEE IF THE ROOM WAS RENTED! the security insisted on sayng they never took ne thing out! i asked for them to check the lost and found and i was told by Amanda that was not possible...I asked for them to read the room lock i was told by Amanda NOT possible or if would take days..I asked to read the saf lock and also was told not possible! PATHETIC!! 2. ALL HALL WAY DOORS NEED WD40 3. THE LAMP SHADES IN THE BATHROOM NEED TO BE CLEANED 4. SOCKS WERE FOUND UNDER THE COUCH THEY DID NOT BELONG TO US 5. THE TOILET HAD HAIR ON IT this is by far the worst experience i have ever had at such a hotel. The staff think they r trying to help by walkign around with wires in their ears but DONT USE EM!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: KatherineID
Reviews.Content: Sets itself apart from most hotels with modern, lovely rooms and unusual hotel configuration. Reception and restaurant on the 25th floor was not in the least inconvenient -- I don't understand why other reviewers complained about it -- but rather a nice variation on the old "walk in the front door and stand at a counter" setup at most hotels. Bathroom was gorgeous. Breakfast buffet in restaurant was very good, though service was a bit lacking. I had a massage and pedicure at the hotel spa. The services themselves were perfectly adequate, but the spa setting was disappointing, with no comfortable place to relax and a rather spartan locker room. Definitely didn't compare with other spa experiences I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of the financial district in Miami. If traveling for business, this is a great location! Some of the earlier reviews knock this location, but it all depends on what you are in Miami for. The check in is located on the 25th floor with amazing views of the city and the bay. The service is first class from the moment you arrive and the valet and doorman meets you at your car. You are escorted in to the building and to the elevators up to the lobby. Upon arrival in the lobby the front desk staff was outstanding. The awkward part is that the rooms are located off of another elevator bank and actually below the lobby. The rooms are nice, but are a bit worn. My room had a great view of the bay and South Beach, but the furnishings were a bit old and worn though. The TV was not up to par and needs to be replaced with a newer one (LCD, Plasma, etc). I was surprised that the TV was old and most likely circa 2000ish. The robes were very nice and the bathroom was excellent (large with a separate shower and tub). The nightly turn down service is also a nice treat, but I was surprised that there was not a mint /choclate on my pillow, as one mught expect from turn down service. Notably absent from the room is a coffee maker. I must say that I was shocked at this. In today's day of business travel, not having a coffee maker in the room is a real miss. It is frustrating to have to order room service just for a cup of coffee. The lobby bar is quite cool and offers outdoor seating where you overlook the bay. All in all, I would recommend this hotel for business travelers in Miami. The service is outstanding! The only negative is that the rooms could use some updating (especially the TV & lack of coffee maker). I would say that this hotel is truly 4 star, and with just a little updating, could be 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool, cannot wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: oskiwow
Reviews.Content: Came in off season for a last minute trip and was pleasantly surprised. Its not really close to the courthouse or financial district, but the rooms are great and the restaurant and common space are just wonderful. I will stay here on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected from a Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: SaltShaker09
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at much better DoubleTrees , Embassy Suites or Hiltons than this COnrad. The location was OK, far from the beach or anything fun ( its in the heart of Business District). The Valet service was 35$ a night, which it what you expect from a conrad, but a little too high if you ask me. The front desk staff were so so. they were polite, but not helpful. Our room wasnt ready by 12, and they were supposed to call us when it was ready. so we had t call around 2, and then they said " oh yeah its ready". By then we had already given our bags to Valet, and they said they will deliver our bags to our room. During check in ( around 2:30) i asked the front desk to have them bring the luggage to our room. needless to say, my girlfriend and i go to our room, take a nap, wake up at 5 and still no luggage. ( however, housekeeping knocked on the door and woke us up, because they thought our room was not clean ). anyways,we had to call again to get our luggage. You'd expect conrad to be better. this hotel did have the most beautiful bathroom/shower/hottub i had ever seen in a hotel, i have to give them that much. But the water piping sucked, every 3-4 mins the pip would rattle and a whistling sound would come from the pipe and the water pressure would fall. My stay included breakfast, and the breakfast was amazing. The restaurant ( ATRIO ) was great. Overall, i didnt like my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & benefits for Diamond VIPs”
Reviews.Author: johnruda
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Conrad for the Saturday night before a cruise (Mar 6) when my partner and I were traveling with another couple. We had a great, simple stay in Miami and would recommend the Conrad for travelers heading to Miami for business or a pre-cruise stay. Service, breakfast, and the pool temperature were there highlights. I was staying on Hilton Honors points, so the room was free and I almost feel guilty that the only money I spent during the one night stay was a $16 gratuity for our waiter at breakfast. I'd happily return to spend more money in the future! What I Liked: - Service was great at the front desk (Marilou) and the concierge desk (Richard) - Despite the hotel being sold out (it was a spring break weekend in Miami), the staff didn't cite it as a reason for any shortcomings; they did their best to meet expectations - I hoped to check in early and called the front desk before 6am to alert them of my early arrival and was pleased to find a room being prepared for us when we arrived at 11:30am - We ended up waiting longer than anticipated for the room since housekeeping noticed a stain on the carpet they needed to remedy; I appreciated the team being proactive! - The concierge gave us a great recommendation for brunch (Balan's), which was very reasonably priced and a nice walk from the hotel - As a Diamond VIP, I was provided with an upgrade to a Bay View Deluxe room #1721(simple, clean, a little small). We weren't blown away, but it met our needs. We also received free internet and two free breakfast buffets. - I received a call in the evening to inquire if there was anything I needed to make the stay satisfactory. I mentioned that we had four people in the room and asked if they'd be able to provide a discounted rate on the breakfast buffet for the thrid and fourth members of our party (the Diamond VIP benefit includes only two complimentary buffets). After being placed on a brief hold, the team member offered to provide a total of four complimentary breakfast buffets. This was above and beyond the service I'd expected an certainly appreciated. - The breakfast buffet was FANTASTIC! The food presentation was great. The wait staff was very attentive with drink refills, etc. - The temperature of the outdoor pool was complete bliss! There are simple cabana areas free of charge. - The team member at the front desk of the spa was very pleasant (and cute!) Items To Be Aware Of: - This property is not well-designed for people looking to party in South Beach since the location isn't very convenient to that area - The outdoor rooftop pool is nice but it is separated from the rest of the hotel and lounge chairs are limited - As other reviewers have mentioned, you'll spend a lot of time riding elevators. I expected it, so I wasn't put off by it. I must admit that occasionally I did press the wrong button a few times, forgetting that I had to go up to go down. - Some details of the room fell short: Our desk lamp was missing a leg on the base, causing it to be tilted and it would rock when touched; one of the reading lamps mounted in the headboard was broken; the bookcase used to store of the minibar snacks was tilted and not fitting correctly against the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Beautiful bay view. Awesome room. Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: chipperuga
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in June 2006. The hotel is classy. Great service from the get-go. We got a drink and a burger at the bar. Watched the World Cup. The room was incredible. The view of the bay was tremendous. The bathroom was nicer than any. Granite from top to bottom. Floor-to-ceiling windows. The bed was awesome. Sheets were so comfortable and clean. The pool was very nice, we were the only people out there.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: jdavis2311
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad in 2007 & 2008 for Memorial day weekend. We rented a two bedroom suite both years. The hotel itself is beautiful, the views of the bay and downtown miami are wonderful. The suite was very spacious and well layed out. My main concern was with the service. THe first year when I booked I was told that there was no deposit required they just needed my card to hold the room but it wouldnt be charged anything until my arrival. LIES! within minutes of completing my reservation with an agent my card was charged first nites rate and tax which was about 500.00ish. Which if I was aware would have happened I could have been prepared for it, but as advised by them it wouldnt be so I was shocked to see it when I checked my account. When I called back to find out why it was charged I was told b/c it was a suite and a popular holiday weekend the deposit was required. My obvious question" Then why would your reps tell me the complete opposite when I specifically asked that question"!?!?! I was given a mere "The agent you spoke with was incorrect, would you like us to cancel and refund it to your card"?! At this point we had already made up our minds that Conrad was where we were staying so I advised them to keep it and to better train their staff on the policies on reservations and what they tell customers. When I actually arrived in May, I was amazed by the hotel but disgusted by the manager on duty and his arrogant staff. The card that I initially booked the room on had been stolen(the reservation was made in Feb) and I had a new one from my bank. Apparently, b/c I had a different card they would require that I put down a whole new deposit!!!! He informed me that the initially 500.00something would be refunded to the account but they werent authorized to let me use a new card to pay the remaining balance on the room. So I had to basically come up with an additional 500.00 that i had already paid these people!!! and wait for the initial 500.00 paid back in Feb to be refunded within 7 business days. Completly unacceptable!!! no kind of apology, or resolution. I asked for the manager who of course was not available but I could leave a message for him, that would be given to him that evening when he started his shift. The message never got to him. The next morning I went to speak with the manager on duty and was given alot of attitude and the impression that he could care less, and I should be glad that I was even staying at their hotel. I was very turned off! It was already my second day and I wasnt going to leave to find another hotel at this point so I stuck it out. So the suite was beautiful and had a full kitchen and everything, washer and dryer and all the amenities that you would expect from a hotel condo rental. The downside is you arent allowed to use these amenities! Minus the fact that I paid almost 2000.00 for this room for the weekend and you all made a disaster of my check in experience I cant use the kitchen pots/pans and washer and dryer? it was ridiculous. Needless to say I enjoyed my weekend even with these mishaps. Like a fool I went back the next year and received very shady, arrognant treatment again! the deposit situation was fine because I was aware of it now. Upon arrival though I was charged more than what I was suppose to b/c there was an extra person in our party and according to them the two bedroom suites were made for only 4 people maximum(we had 5) So why is there a dining room table with a set up for 6? Very minor mishap and the additional charge wasnt alot but it was enough to turn me off and make me not want to return. This year I will be staying at the Epic Hotel for Memorial Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, great views, but you've got to like riding elevators”
Reviews.Author: mowfam
Reviews.Content: A bit of a nuisance having to ride two elevators to go from the ground floor to my expansive room on the 16th. An express elevator takes you to the 25 floor lobby with fantastic views of Biscayne Bay. But then you have to take an other set of elevators down to the guestrooms. It took 3 elevator rides to get to the pool from the room. My room on the 16th floor was large and very nicely furnished though it was beginning to look worn. I'd stay there again if on business but I think I would prefer something more traditional like the JW Marriott next door if I had the family.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, poor delivery”
Reviews.Author: angmohgao
Reviews.Content: The Good: This hotel has a great location on Brickell Avenue. If you need to be in downtown Miami, it's convenient. It's close to the people mover and to the new restaurant and bar areas of downtown. Restaurant has a view of downtown and has a pretty good buffet. The bar has views of the bay. The Bad: The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor. You have to wait a long time to get in a small elevator to go up. Then you wait in line a long time to check in or ask questions. Then you take another small elevator to your floor (after waiting). The Ugly: I paid full fare for a suite. It was actually a condo on the upper floors. So it was huge with lots of room. Problem was that it lacked the amenities and service of a hotel room. It felt like I was staying alone in a condo or timeshare, NOT in a luxury hotel. When you check in there are 3-4 people jockeying to help you. Apparently they all want to get tips when one person would be enough. Overall this was not a good experience. A Hampton Inn typically has better service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad - overpriced but good quality”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Conrad during first week of Jan 2010. Overall I found the Hotel to be understaffed and overpriced, yet contained some great aspects. Front desk service ok but completely under-staffed. Lengthy waiting times experienced and incorrect info provided by one guy at Front-Desk. Lost our bags en route to room twice. My hotel room was large, bathroom over-sized, nice bay view (sadly windows filthy with bird poos). Hotel Spa was great. Very pleasant professional Spa staff. Restaurant food was excellent quality but very over-priced. Cocktail bar attendant (female) was excellent but beverages and wines very over-priced. Room Service food was extremely high quality and expensive. Concierge friendly, knowledgable and professional. Nothing close-by. Cinema & Mall 25 mins drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, service not great, rooms not cleaned well”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad for a short four day vacation. We arrived at 3pm, check in time, but the room was not ready. The front desk confirmed our reservation for bay view, highest floor possible, away from the elevator, and foam pillows. The front desk staff was friendly, but they were not particularly effective. We waited with several other hotel clients in the bar for about an hour. We were hungry but they stopped serving lunch at 2 pm. The front desk staff arranged to allow the hotel patrons that were waiting to order from the limited food or drink menu. The wait staff was not happy to make this accommodation. My husband and I ate, and then walked the city, still waiting for our room. We returned to the hotel and since the room still wasn't ready the front desk gave us 2 drinks comp. We had time to drink the 2 comp drinks, order an appetizer, order 2 more drinks, and watch part of a bowl game. The wait staff (the night shift by this time) noticed how long we waited and checked on our room for us. We were allowed to check in over three hours after we first arrived. The front desk did not confirm the room rate, or length of reservation. When we finally were allowed into the room, our room was facing the bay, but it was directly across from the service elevator. Make no mistake, there was constant noise coming from the area that contained a service elevator, laundry room, and storage room. We travel with an ambient sound machine so we were able to drown out the noise. We were pretty sure that if we tried to change rooms we would not have the bay view, and we would have to wait even longer for another room so we did not complain. The hotel brags a pillow menu. However, we only received the foam (not feather that were in the room) pillows we requested with our reservation, and at check in, by calling housekeeping several times. Housekeeping does not seem to be aware of the pillow menu the hotel brags about. Housekeeping did not vacuum the floors during our entire stay. We also suspect the floors were not vacuumed prior to our arrival as we never heard a vacuum cleaner running during our entire stay. Room service was very prompt, and the food was good. However, after 30 minutes no matter what you order, even hot tea, room service will call you to pick up the tray, table, or hot kettle. It was annoying. The concierge is very kind and accommodating. However, their walking directions are not accurate. If you are not slightly familiar with the city they will give you directions that will get you lost. Be prepared to ask someone once you exit the hotel. The website claims there are flat screen TV's in the room. Be aware that they are flat panel tube TV's, not actually flat screen TV's. We asked for a late check out and the front desk was accommodating. However, upon check out the front desk staff never asked how our stay was, or if we wanted a printed receipt of the charges. They were not rude, just indifferent. My husband and I are used to staying at Hilton Honors hotels that have better customer service. Unfortunately for the Conrad, even the Hampton Inn or the Hilton Gardens Hotel has better customer service. I agree with a previous poster, there are too many choices in Miami, with comparable prices, in the same area to settle on the Conrad Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good from the outside, but the details are missing.”
Reviews.Author: shciteb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in a two week period for business. We held the meetings at the hotel. The business center and banquet service was outstanding. It's the rooms that did not measure up. On arriving, I was asked if I wanted a paper. Yes. I never got one. When I went to open the mini bar for water after a run around bay, there was no mini bar key in the folder they gave me. Supposedly, they offered turned down service. I never got it. As a woman who presents at meetings all day, I need bathrooms that have good lighting for getting ready in the morning. The Conrad does not have it. My face in the light of day looked a little garish because I simply could not see under the yellowish tinted lights. And even though the bathrooms are a good size and have both a shower and tub, the water pressure was not good. To the Conrad's credit, I answered a comment card knowing that I was coming back the next week. They gave me a room with a view of the bay. My paper showed up. And I had the right keys. Only when I turned on the water to take a bath in my corner bathroom, black water spit out of the faucet. I would not go back. Too many other choices in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Trendy0156
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Conrad in Miami and I was very pleased. The rooms were simple, clean, and had everything I needed. The hotel is in the business district so its not loud like South Beach, but is conveniently located making it easy to take a quick taxi ride to the beach. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and bars to get a drink in Mary Brickell Village. The hotel restaurant had a great happy hour and very nice views of the city. The staff were all friendly and attentive. I would certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: jaison_lives
Reviews.Content: I love the Conrad Miami hotel! The service was remarkable, and timely. The staff was very professional and courteous, from the Valet staff upon our arrival, to the Concierge, as well as the registration staff. We were always adressed by name and with a smile. The room was a double, with pillowtop beds and a beautiful marble bathroom equipped with a garden tub and stand alone glass door shower. The fitness center is amazing and huge, full of equipment and even complementary cold water. The housekeeping staff was very thorough, this place is clean! I can't wait to return to the Conrad. Special thanks to George in Valet, Christopher and Lauren in the registration lobby.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: rodrigopuga
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, nice serviÃ§e, special view and perfect area to stay. Downtown has grown a lot in the last 10 years and has a lot to offer to the visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Most of the time”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: I have been to this property a couple of times; the first time I wnt there I was upgraded to a 1br residence, which was one of the best places I have stayed at!!! The staff was very friendly and accomodating as a Gold VIP I was given free breakfast which was great!!!, I returned one more time for my girlfriends birthday and I order a bottle of wine in the room for our arrival (This time I was a Diamond VIP) Not only the bottle of wine was not in the room but my room was overlooking at another building. When I called the manager in regards to this he apologized and said that someone was let go earlier that morning and that was the person who took my order and although they did comped and bring the wine, they charged me for it in my final bill (They took it off at check out though). Since then I have decided not to stay at the Conrad and although I had an appoiment 2 months ago in that building I rather stayed at the far superior JW Marriott two streets down (By the way although they still do the breakfast for HHonnors members is just muffins and orange juice now, is in no way comparable with the stuff they have at the JW) In the good side the pool and the whole hotel design is one of the hottest I have ever seen!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you get a deal, book it!”
Reviews.Author: Tinabean
Reviews.Content: I took a blind chance on Hotwire and ended up at the Conrad. I did a bit of research and was a bit wary of what I would find once I got there. Overall - the place is pretty sweet. The elevator situation is odd, but normal for a multi-purpose building such as this. The room that was assigned was really nothing special. I asked for a non-corner room with a bay view and was informed that would cost an additional outrageous charge. So I declined and was led to a closet-sized space with a mediocre view of the city. But the space was clean, the bathroom was huge (great shower!) and the bed and linens were up to par. A few things I was looking forward to, such as the ipod dock and pillow menu were painfully missing. I even asked about the ipod dock, but nobody in the place seemed to know what I was talking about despite the fact it's listed on their website. I hated (read: HATED) the feather pillows on the bed and asked room service to bring up others, or provide the much acclaimed pillow menu. Again, nobody knew what I was talking about, and if I weren't having such a good time, I probably would've made a bit more of a scene about it. I hate a stiff neck and feather pillows always make me sneeze. Nonetheless, I had other things on this trip to take my mind off pillows and all was forgotten. I went looking to get ice upon arrival - and let it be known you cannot get your own ice. If it weren't for the very gracious housekeeping woman who informed me of this and promptly filled my bucket, I would've wandered the halls for an hour. Guess she knew I really needed that champagne... Housekeeping seemed to be the most on-the-ball staffers here. They were ever present and eager to help in any way, and they do a great job at keeping things spotless and fresh. We ate at the Atrio on level 25 - fantastic views, good drinks can be had and they do have a happy hour that kept them relatively affordable. The food was meh. I don't mind paying for quality, but it was all fluff and very little substance. In other words, don't eat there hungry. I'm guessing nobody in Miami eats a proper meal, or at least not in public. But the decor and ambiance was pretty hip - and their choice in music was spot on - the service was good and friendly. One thing to note, the front desk staff seemed useless to me. Aside from standing there staring at you when you get on and off the elevator, they essentially know nothing about the hotel. The concierge, however, was very helpful and knowledgeable. I lost my phone charger and the concierge dug in the back room for a while searching through the lost and found for a compatible one. The person at the front desk had no clue there was even a box of phone chargers back there. Even though there was no match, I appreciated the time and effort. Sometimes it's the little things that make a big difference. If I hadn't grabbed this hotel so cheaply on Hotwire, I don't think I would've picked it. Overall, I'm glad that's where we landed, but I have no reason to really go back. They could definitely do better with actually providing what they say the do and training some staff better, but the hotel is on the right track. I never felt uncomfortable in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: krisell333
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the Conrad Hotel but it was very enjoyable and relaxing. We got a 1-bedroom bay view residence suite and may I say the room was WOW! I read a few reviews with people saying the rooms at the Conrad are small and a bit worn...not this one. Our suite on the 26th floor was very luxurious and comfortable with 2 walls of floor-to-ceiling windows. We had views of the water (of course!), Key Biscayne, Miami Beach, and the causeways. It was spectacular! The suite had a complete kitchen w/ stainless steel appliances and granite, a washer/dryer, nice dinette table, great living a bed rooms. The bathroom was very luxurious with granite and tile and a separate tub and shower. The only cons on the room was the tv in the living room is in this nook in the wall and it was a little low and there seemed to be a little too much dust in bedroom. That's probably just from all of the windows though. Neither was that big of deal. The service at the Conrad is amazing, def 4 star! We enjoyed the bar at Level 25, but did not visit the restaurant. The pool area is nice as well. Yes the layout at the hotel is a bit strange, with you having to take one set of elevators to the 25th floor and then another to your room, but whatever not that big of a deal. The only other thing I would say is that the room service food was dry. I had to put a lot of syrup on my waffles, it was a shame b/c they were really good just dry. So were the pancakes and the omelette. Would I stay here again? Yes, but it would definitely have to be in one of the residence suites again. I guess im just spoiled now, lol ;)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful space and views, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: The views are dramatic from the 25th floor sky lobby/bar and the space is beautifully decorated. The staff on check in was extremely professional and personal. Disappointments and criticisms: My assigned room (more below) was already showing signs of wear. The wood on the dresser the television sat on was beat up and the wood veneer separating from the material underneath. There was a very large, dark stain on the carpet between the bed and the closet where something had spilled and splattered. Something had been spilled on the windowsill too, and was still there. The hotel seemed quite empty given four floors of nearly empty "valet-only" parking spaces in the deck, and very little traffic in the bar and restaurant, but no room upgrade was offered despite Gold HH status. Breakfast and internet were provided though, so no cause to complain perhaps. I do complain though for a different reason: the map of rooms on the back of the room door (21st floor) indicated that a handful of rooms were narrower than the standard size rooms on that floor (I'm not counting the really large rooms that showed on the map, which I assume are suites or something). Mine was one of the few narrow rooms. Because of this, there was very little room between the end of the bed and the front of the dresser and television - the room had a very cramped feeling. Also, nearly half the room was an even narrower unusable/unfurnished space from the door to where the room opened up and became larger. This particular room was also right next to the elevator and so there was the constant sound of the elevator coming and going. My point: why not be aware of which rooms on a floor are less desireable than others (they are smaller; they are noisier), and make an effort to first assign other rooms without these problems if you have space? I'd recommend the hotel give that some thought to that. Had a quieter, less cramped, and cleaner room been assigned, I would probably stay again. At this point, I'll check out other options before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great views... Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: mrcorleone
Reviews.Content: I chose the Conrad as weekend Birthday celebration getaway for my boyfriend and I. The packages they offered were quite generous and being in Brickell it seemed like a great fit for a great weekend. Upon arrival we were greeted by the valet and bellman, your typical hotel service that makes you exhale and get ready to relax. The service ended there, as you walk into the hotel you have to take an elevator up 25 floors to reach check -in, when we arrived there was only one person working the desk - but it was not busy. She was courteous but not friendly. I was able to overlook this by looking out at the bay - the views are beautiful. Our room was decent, a king size bed and a corner location which opted for stunning views in all directions. Upon unpacking my toiletries I almost sliced my finger open on the broken glass tray - very poor in my opinion, as well as the soaps - they were very cheap and smelled bad for what is supposed to be a upper end hotel. we had room service a few times and felt it to be lacking - and the room service attendants as well as other hotel employees were very defensive when I said something wasn't right - a very big turn off for me - when staying at a hotel I do want to worry about anything and instead of just rectifying the problems they made me to feel as if it were my fault - very rude in fact. I could have overlooked some of this with room service understanding not everything will be perfect but what set me off the most was the Spa service. I had booked a surprise facial for my boyfriend. I was told to arrive 15 minutes before his appointment. That morning we took the elevator to the 24 floor to step into noise, the fitness center is adjoined to the Spa, there was a gentleman in gym gear yelling on his phone about business, at first I thought we were in the wrong place yet we weren't there just wasn't anyone at the reception desk to greet us. We sat for 15 minuted before the esthetician came out, when I told her we had been sitting there for 15 minutes she told me my appointment was at 12:30 and that I was wrong and the receptionist was on lunch. She was very rude - when the receptionist came back I had explained the same thing and she just told me she has no control, she was on her lunch break and that she wasn't the one to book the appointment. There was no empathy or "how can I fix this" mentality. I was very disappointed and for $165 facial I expected much better service - I would never recommend the spa to anyone. My boyfriend did say the facial was nice but you can get nice anywhere for a lot less. It felt more like a salon than a spa. Overall the location and views were nice but that is where the positives end for the Conrad. I probably would not recommend the hotel unless someone is looking to specifically stay in the financial district. I found the staff lacked professionalism and overall service - when I stay at highly rated hotels - I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat over-rated, with a confusing layout”
Reviews.Author: Circusdog
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the JW Marriott across the street when on business in Miami, but decided a change would be good and chose the Conrad. The staff were polite and professional, but I found the elevator system to be annoying (the hotel is on the 25th floor, and you have to go around two corners and down a corridor to access the guest room elevators). The reception desk advised that I could self-park across the street, however upon checking out the parking garage told me that they didn't do this any more and any cars left overnight would now be towed! The room was clean, the amenities satisfactory, but I prefer the straight-forward layout and normal parking set-up of the JW, which is the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice up end rooms, confusing elevators, odd tipping rules”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler004
Reviews.Content: Very attractive property with surprisingly confusing elevator pattern. Hilton Diamond treatment nothing special here but the hotel aspires to 4 Seasons care -- shoe shines, turn downs with wooden trays, overpriced breakfasts. This is strictly a biz hotel, Brickell Ave is quiet (or worse) at night so look at it as a point accumulator for a good bit off the cost of the nearby 4 Seasons. Front desk was very friendly -- every one was. The resto puts an 18% gratuity on the bill, perhaps becuase so many foreigners dont understand US tipping or maybe becuase they haven't been called on it (enough).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Leftthedog
Reviews.Content: Convenient to Port of Miami. We did get this room with our Hilton Honors for free and paid a small amount for an upgrade to a corner room. I was a bit worried from all the reviews but we were very happy. The trip to the pool is a bit strange but not a big deal. The view out our bathroom wall of windows was of another residence but with the bay beyond. We walked down to the water right after the sun came up.The bathroom is huge. We walked to the Brickell Village for dinner feeling safe and to a grocery store in the morning. The front desk was helpful and the bellhops pleasant. The room itself was not huge but clean and met our needs complete with flat screen T.V. I have no complaints and we will stay here again in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “stupid layout”
Reviews.Author: zcai
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is on the 25th floor. If your room is on the 9th floor, you still have to go to the 25th floor and transfer to another elevator to get to your room. It seems a waste of time and electricity to me. The pool is nice. But again, imaging your room on the 9th floor. You have to take one elevator to the 25th, transfer to another elevator, get to the ground floor, walk across street, take another elevator to the 13th floor in order to use the pool. But the time you get there, you are already tired if your time isn't up. Rooms are small. Bathroom counter top is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Big money for Big hassle”
Reviews.Author: MCKNJ
Reviews.Content: This is the most boring hotel that I have ever stayed in. There is no life here what so ever. Could be because it's such a hassle to get to the lobby, then your room. You have to take 1 elevator to check in. Then a different elevator to go to your room. If you want to enjoy the pool, you have to take a 3rd elevator and it takes time to do this. If your on the go, this is not the place for you. I took my 2 elevator trips to my room twice only to have my key not work. Back for another 2 elevator rides to get a new key. I was quite annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & service”
Reviews.Author: LaurenV
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful, relaxing stay - plus it was a great value (valet parking is pretty expensive though). The service was amazing...really genuine. Great view, free coffee station in the morning. Rooms are clean and modern. The only people I wouldn't recommend this for would be spring breakers. Basically, its a great location to really experience Miami, and get away from the craziness when you need to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LuxTravelerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Was in town to entertain clients! Central location to Capitol Grille, Miami CVB and Miami Auto Spa.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: kw09
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Conrad. The room was beautiful - using our Hilton Diamond status got us a wonderful upgraded room with awesome views of the water. continental breakfast was disappointing - opted for other things on the menu which were much better. hostess service in the restaurant was poor; other employees were wonderful - brought us a refrigerator to the room and specific types of pillows. we were travelling on gov't rate so it wasn't too badly priced but i wouldn't pay the normal fees for the room - too pricey. Other inconvenience - you had to go outside to another building to use the pool and tennis courts - way too many switching of elevators to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spoil your Miami experience”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterLT
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself is nice, the service was horrible - the worst service experience of any class hotel I have stayed in. The reception staff was either completely new, because I had to explain to them what they needed to do, or just did not care. They gave me the wrong type and number of breakfast coupons, champagne delivery was late by 30-40 minutes (I was told they were cooling it off :) ), and in general I got the feeling that my girlfriend and I were just distracting them from something important. The room was modern and good, but no one explained to me how to operate the technology that was not completely integrated (thankfully, the mechanic I had called shared this secret information with me), so I had to juggle among 3 different remotes, and still the TV would not turn off or on from the first attempt. To summarize, if you plan to spend this amount of money, you are most likely better off staying at another five star hotel in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Travel to Miami at leat once a month on business and have am Hilton VIP Gold and Marriott Elite Gold. I have stayed at the Conrad about 6 times over the past few years and every time I stay there I am so disappointed. It's actually a beautiful property but has terrible service - all around and everytime. It's amazing how consistent the poor service is throughout the hotel. I notice it everytime I stay there and this last tstay will be my last. The JW Marriott next door and even the newly renovated Marriott Biscayne offer far better service. The issues are not major but they happen often enough to be annoying. Among them: * Long lines at check in and unfriendly staff * Small gym with no headphones ("they have all been stolen") * No newspaper delivery * Charge gold members for internet (Marriott does not) * Loud rap music plays by pool and at lounge (Business people stay here - not spring breakers!) * Took 30 minutes to get a drink in lounge (literally) and that was only after we chased her down. Both times I visited lounge there was only one waitress serving whole lounge. Bartender is miserable. * 15 minute wait for breakfast while many tables were empty. Business people do not have time for that. Continental buffet was very limited and not replenished both mornings. Really bad service too. One morning we just left after never getting our check. We were in a hurry and there was no one to be found. Was never even offered coffee the entire breakfast. * Doormen just stand and stare at you as you struggle in with your luggage. Holding the door is out of the question. Very obvious hotel is short staffed. I know hotels are cutting back but the hotel was busy so no need to have limited staff. I receive better service at Hilton and Marriott. Not sure what the Conrad name get s you.............

Reviews.Title: “Great location - horrible service”
Reviews.Author: GMan61
Reviews.Content: This trip was a combination personal/business trip so I stayed at the Conrad as it is on my company's "preferred" list of hotels in Miami. This was my first stay and certainly my last. In terms of location, it was perfect - within the financial district where I needed to be for business and a short drive to South Beach for pleasure. The King room I stayed in was spacious though not that large. I have several gripes about the hotel: - the room I was given was a handicapped room which was fitted for wheelchair access, etc. Not being disabled, I couldn't understand why I was given that room however when I noticed the fold down seat in the shower, the small sink and other accomodations for disabled people, I called the front desk and requested a room change. I also mentioned the noise from the housekeeping closet next to my room. In the hour I was in the room, the housekeeping closet door slammed at least 5 times so I knew it was going to be a problem in the early morning hours. I was told the room was given to me as it was requested by my company's travel agency. This is the most ridiculous excuse I ever heard! I travel at least every other week, know my agent very well and therefore know this was just the desk clerk's way of shifting responsibility. On my request for a room change, I was told the hotel was fully booked (very hard to believe) and that I would receive a call the next morning offering me a new room. I stayed in the Conrad 3 nights and no one ever called back. You would think someone who is a VIP member of Hilton Honors would be treated better. Another complaint about this hotel is the parking fee: $27 dollars a day for valet parking! When I mentioned this was excessive, I was told I had the option to self-park but this would cost $25 and I had to pay each tie I exited the garage. How ridiculous! A friend came to the hotel for a drink and was charged the $27 valet fee for 3 hours. A couple of other complaints: Though the bed was a king size, it sunk on one side and so it was very uncomfortable to sleep in. You can hear everything from the adjoining room. I mean EVERYTHING! After being kept up late each night, I had to wake when I heard their alarm go off at 6:00 am. I have advised my company's travel department about these issues and recommended the Conrad be removed from the preferred list.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: kuki
Reviews.Content: Five star. Never. Only good thing about this hotel is that rooms are quite good. Breakfast is just a disaster, but a room service is even worse. If I tell here all bad things about this property it will take a whole day. I just can't believe that this is Conrad. Next time I'll stay at Four Seasons next door. Just stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Shannon W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and for the cost of the room, service was lacking the high quality expected at a Conrad. After dropping off our bags earlier and then checking in a few hours later, the bellman was not able to find our bags. It took 2 hours to bring them up after repeated calls. Other inconveniences and lack of service contributed to this review. The room and bathroom are beautifully decorated and look very modern and sleek. For the price paid at this hotel, the staff at the Conrad Miami could improve by responding more promptly and be more willing to help its guests.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: SandieMarie
Reviews.Content: After searching trip advisor looking for a hotel for a pre cruise stay I found a great deal on City & Show for the Conrad thanks everyone for your tips and advise regarding where to find the rooms etc. We booked two rooms one of rooms was suitable for disabled guest so was larger than ours Never the less rooms sizes great. Reception very helpful no complaints bell boy a bit grumpy (must have had a bad day!) The hotel is just outside the metro mover a free service running every 7 mins or so which take you downtown to bayside etc or taxis just outside. As we were going on a cruise didnt go too far cafes just outside. Rooms very nicely decoorated nice bed linens , slippers and robe all available to buy! all fresh and new and a nice view of the pool/tennis courts which was empty and we had a sauna again we had it all to ourselves, (just ask them to switch them on before you go down) Spa staff very pleasant. Great size bathroom separate shower big enough for two!!!! Overall who stay again for a post or pre cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnSwansea_U_K_
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel, this time it was with my wife who shares my opinion. This is a quality property with excellent service. It is not a good hotel for those who want a beachside property as it is in one of the business districts of Miami. The service is all you would expect of a 5 star property. The rooms / suites are of a high standard with all necessary accoutrements. There is one restaurant for all meals, I have enjoyed eating here however the buffet breakfast is rather poor in comparison with others that I have experienced. the bar at night on the occassions I have been there was quiet but they serve some excellent snacks at prices that are not too high considering the standard of hotel. My experience of the bell desk was fantastic, having suffered a Hertz BMW car breakdown they sent my luggage to my breakdown location and the staff member stayed with me to translate as the driver of the pick up was Cuban and my Spanish is fairly non existent. thanks Francisco and your colleagues you are a credit to the the Conrad group. I would definitely stay there again if visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, yet unwelcoming service”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night in Miami. Upon check-in I was greeted by a new, younger employee who had trouble processing my check-in with Hilton HHonors. Not only was the agent young and had pierces, he also was not professional in welcoming me. The supervisor, who was slightly older came over and processed my check-in and gave me an upgrade ocean view room. The room was amazingingly comfortable and well kept, except that there were redwine stains on the floor and the wheels on the desk chair were broken. Bed was amazingly comfortable and bathroom was large and spacious. Everything else was fine except until after check-out. I had to store my luggage for the day as I had an evening departure at MIA. No problem dropping off luggage, however upon pick-up that changed. I waited 25 minutes for the concierge to retrieve my luggage. Upon asking what the delay was for, he said "Sir I apologize for the delay. I need to work on this situation for another guest". While this is an amazingly modern and comfortable hotel, I'll be taking my business to the JW Marriott nextime I'm in the area as a result of the (lack of) service

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: EmmainFrance
Reviews.Content: I booked the Conrad Miami for a two-night stay while travelling around Florida. The hotel is situated in the business district but there are a few restaurants and local bars in the vacinity so you can go out and about if necessary. The first impression of the hotel was the right one....a beautiful hotel; from the general decor, to the restaurant where breakfast is served. The Conrad has a very contemporary style and is imaculately kept, with most of the public areas looking brand new. On checking into my room I actually thought I had been given an upgrade to a superior category, but no, this was a standard room|! Extremely large bedrooms, with an even larger bathroom. Great selection of products in the bathroom, and the bedroom was equipped with a coffee machine, flatscreen tv, dvd, the works - very impressive. Although I didn't use the spa, I did go and have a look and it looked stunning! I did have the time to use the outdoor swimming pool, and although it was smaller than I exepected, the pool area is very welcoming with a lovely sun terrace and some nice views out to the sea. There is a nice bar on the 25th floor where you can take advanctage of sitting outside (if you're lucky enough to get a space as there is only limited seating) and the restaurant is nicely decorated just nextdoor. All in all, I found this hotel portrayed the true values of a five star deluxe hotel and was very impressive. Only small disadvantage is the split of the hotel between two buildings which means you need to leave the main building to go over to the fitness centre/swimming pool but this was a small detail and did not detract from my stay. If I get the chance to stay again, I would jump at the opportunity and higly recommend it to anyone travelling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: LifeofLeisure
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Conrad Miami. Postives: View from the bar balcony and the room, Friday happy hour, comfortable bed and pillows, front desk and room service, location-- near good restaurants (Morton's, Novecento, Gordon Biersch). Negatives: valet staff and concierge were not very friendly or helpful, the hotel set-up (take an elevator up to 25 to get to the lobby and then a separate elevator back down to the rooms + the pool is in a separate building so you have to walk outside to get to it).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad for a night during a weekend in August. I spent most of the weekend away from the hotel, but I thought the room was very pleasant, and I had a nice sea view. The bathroom was spacious and the bed was very comfortable - I slept for 8 straight hours, which was very unusual for me. The staff were also very warm and friendly. I highly recommend the 'continental' buffet breakfast at the restaurant on the 25th floor, an excellent spread of delicious fruit, cereals, cold cuts and some of the best coffee this side of the Atlantic. I also thought the gym on the 24th floor was excellent, all cardio equipment had individual TV screens, and was well equipped both with machines, weights and also towels, water and cleaning equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Wierd Layout”
Reviews.Author: Middle_Aged_Guy
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in was quite large, also had a large bathroom. It had very comfortable beds and a pretty large TV. Nothing to complain about here. As with most upper scale hotels, it had a pretty nice gym. Not large but pretty well equipped. The room view was nice but it was blocked by a large building, picture attached. Check in and check out service was friendly and quick. The hotel layout was really wierd. You had to go up one set of elevators to the 25th floor (I think) to check in. You then went down a different set of elevators to get to your room. The journey to the pool area consisted of taking three sets of elevators: one to get back to the 25th floor, one to go down to the street level to walk across the loading area, and then another set of elevators up to the roof of an adjacent building where the pool was located. It was way too much hassle and I skipped swimming in the pool. I ate the breakfast in the restaurant on the 25th floor. View was nice and buffet continental breakfast was pretty good. It was not a bargain but was reasonable relative to the ambiance. I used Hilton Points to stay at this hotel but I have to believe there are hotels with a better layout and an unblocked view for the around $200+ a night it normally costs to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rating would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: skorpina6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Miami in June of 2008 (last week). It was amazing, the location was in the downtown area, there was a very chic cafe nearby and restaurant (Segofreddo and Novecento). Publix is walking distance (all item supermarket and pharmacy). Anyways the hotel was super clean, the staff comes to your room twice daily to clean up and shape up your room. The bathroom is HUGE. Very modern, amazing bath products from London, close up mirror (lighted), extra towels, robes, slippers, etc. The room was VERY roomy (i had a 2 double beds), with windows facing the water. Swimming pool is very cool, great hip music playing on speakers, ideal for families or singles, or business travelers. Fresh fruit passes you by in a bowl on hot days complimentary, lemon water, etc. Tennis courts below. Theyve thought of everything at this hotel. 25th floor lobby has an amazing outdoor little bar area overlooking the view also very cool at night for a pre-drink. Would definitely stay here again. South Beach is not too far 10 min cab ride. Brickell area really nice and nice crowd as well. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in Miami”
Reviews.Author: JonhSP
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at Conrad. This hotel is fantastic. The staff really knows how to make their guests feel special, there is a girl from the front desk (whose name I do not remember) who is very kind and helpful. She gave us an upgrade as we were there to celebrate our 1 year of marriage, and the room seems more to be an apartment than a room. IÂ´ll be back as soon as possible. The only problem I saw is related to the valet parking, the drivers are very lazy, you can wait minutes for you car.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love the Conrad!”
Reviews.Author: JandR08
Reviews.Content: This was our post-cruise stay (May 23-25). It was our second time staying at the Conrad and have loved both visits. Super hotel and excellent service. We checked in at 9 am from the cruise and they had a room ready for us which was amazing. Got upgraded to a suite and enjoyed the spacious living room/kitchen and separate bedroom. I loved the pillow selection you can order specifically a different pillow - nice touch. We use the free internet in the lobby. There are Â½ price cocktails from 5-8 pm on Friday nights (I think) which is a deal and a great view from the bar on the 25th floor. They say you cannot bring in your own alcohol due to their liquor license - first time I had seen that. Rented movies from the blockbuster a short walk away and enjoyed watching dvds in the suite one night. Fitness room is pretty well set up and water/headsets/newspapers for your use. Love using the tennis court on the roof (they have rackets and balls at the fitness centre) and location is by the pool. Pool/hot tub is great with very helpful staff to find unused chairs, and fresh towels. Concierge can be quite helpful for dinner reservations and recommendations. They could beef up their repetoire though as so much to choose from in the area. We found renting a car was cheaper by calling Hertz than booking through the conceirge. Note that taking a taxi from the Conrad to Hertz, Hertz will cover the taxi ride. Would stay again at the Conrad for a downtown Miami location. Super quality stay - nothing can beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in Brickell area of Miami”
Reviews.Author: sc4eva
Reviews.Content: Completed a three night stay at this hotel for a work function. It is located in the Brickell area of Miami which is more focused towards business travelers than vacationers. South Beach is only a 10-15 min drive from the hotel but can cost anywhere from $25-$35 via a cab. You can drive to many areas including Key Biscayne within minutes. The hotel itself is very nice and on the upper floors of a large office building.
