As previous members mentioned the hotel does overcharge for everything and you do need to check your bill and prices before leaving the property. We did not eat at the hotel itself but went to the Brickell Village area for dinner one night which is only a 5-10 min walk but offers a good number of places to eat. We wanted to check out Novecento and the Segafreddo cafe across from the hotel but did not have a chance to. For breakfast skip the overpriced hotel lobby and go next door to the small cafe/diner for a filling meal.

Reviews.Title: “Be weary of Double charges + more”
Reviews.Author: redgoldgreenusvi
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, with the double charge from the hotel restaurant totaling almost $400 or maybe I should start with check in when they told us as we checked in that the AC had not been working for 2 hours, I actually made the reservation during the AC outage last minute which they only told us after we paid. I later realized that the valet added a nice black stripe (aka scratch) across my white bumper. And if that wasn't all, I got a call from my bank card telling me that I was double charged for dinner, same amount minus .30 cents, is this a scam for out of towners? Well I am not an out of towner I live in Ft Laud lived in South Beach for 8 years, and to me, unfortunately, this seems typical of miami hotel behavior I had only hoped for better from a 4 star hotel like the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Slymon
Reviews.Content: This is not a good facility- they slip in overcharges on your restaurant bill whenever possible. I wanted a duplicate copy of my restaurant receipt, was told there wasn't one available, and had to ask the manager three times for it. Over a week later, it was sent to me, with a 19% 'service charge' tacked on to the final tally even though the menu does not state this fee is added on. It is too bad because this could be a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of calm in a bustling city!”
Reviews.Author: gmwhite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a family tour of florida. Our family consists of parents and children aged 20, 19 ,16, 16 and 4. We booked directly with the hotel who only took a deposit and then paid the final bill when we wre there. On check in the receptionists verified with us in writing the agreed room rate which was the signed by both parties. We had two rooms with 2 double beds in each. Unfortunately there were no rooms available nect to each other, or even on the same floor, in fact we were 2 floors apart. This was only a minor problem and in fact worked out quite well as one of the rooms we were given was a disabled access room so was significantly larger. The views from both rooms were excellent and the cleanliness of the rooms and the hotel in general was excellent. The bathrooms are very large and have a separate bath and shower cubicle and a large range of molton brown toiletries. Breakfast was average and quite expensive. The breakfast room is also very small meaning there is often a wait. There is a cafe across the road from the hotel which serves food all day and serves breakfast all day (but has a larger selection in the mornings) which is a better option for breakfast if u want more than a bit of fruit and cereal. Across from this there are a couple more restaurants but we didnt get a chance to try any out. The room service is very good quality with a large choice and good service. There is a pool on the roof top with a pool bar and also two tennis courts where rackets and balls can be hired (and they dont seem to get angry when u tell them you have lost all the balls over the side of the building!!) There is also a spa and a gym on the 24th floor, the gym is excellent and very well equipped without being too big and is rarely very busy as it is open 24hours. The hotel itself is in the business district which is not so good if u are looking for shops and nightlife on your doorstep but is excellent if u want a more peacefull retreat within the city. Across the road from the hotel is the station for the sky train which is free and takes u to various popular locations in the city. Be warned however as it can be confusing as it only goes in one direction so if u want to get back to a previous stop u have to sit tight until it has gone around the whole circuit! Whilst in florida we stayed in 5 different hotels and have to say that this is the favourite based on best service, best room, biggest bathroom, and best food. I would definatley recommend it, for business or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else but Conrad in Miami”
Reviews.Author: tqlagold
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at Conrad Miami. We got some issues during our stay, but everything was resolved very quickly and professionally, they made sure that we leave the hotel happy. We're supposed to stay for 3 nights during winter music conference 2008. But on the first day we got there, they oversold our room. We had just drove for 1 hour (from fort lauderdale to miami, really bad traffic on friday afternoon), took my friend to south beach to his hotel (Bay Breeze hotel, really bad service) and they couldn't find his reservation and literally kicked him out. Came to conrad and didn't have a room. But the front desk manager (Ignacio) was really nice, they offered to move us to Intercontinental hotel for 1 night for free. So the next day, after cheking out from Intercontinental, we checked in to Conrad at 12:30pm. They accomodated us with early check in, because we had to check out at noon from Inter. They upgraded our room to King with bayview. It was the same room we had last year. I love it. Love the view from the bathroom window looking down to the pool area. We left to go to a party in south beach, and when we arrived back to the hotel that night, they left us a bottle of red wine as a sincere apology for selling our room the night before. Awesome. The next day, we had breakfast at their restaurant. The hostess was really nice. But we experienced some problem with the waitress. The food took long (about 10 minutes). And 5 minutes after the food came, the waitress dropped off the bill on our table, without even asking if we need anything else. We set the bill aside on the chair because I just don't like seeing a bill in front of me while I'm eating. I left the restaurant to go to the pool and my friend stayed to finish his dessert from the buffet. While he was eating dessert and reading newspapers, the waitress came and said: I can take the bill now. That was really rude. The manager came and apologized, and complimented our breakfast. The restaurant was not busy. It's not like they need our booth for other patrons. But....overall, I love staying at Conrad. The food at the restaurant and room service was awesome. Despite the problems that happened over the weekend, I would still stay at Conrad Miami. I actually only want to stay at Conrad if I go to Miami (which is pretty often).

Reviews.Title: “Ruddy good suite”
Reviews.Author: WYW
Reviews.Content: I checked in quite late in the evening and was told there were no non-smoking rooms left, so I would have to have a smoking room for the first night of my 2 night stay. Ho hum I thought, but they said I'd been upgraded to a suite so didn't mind too much. Anyway, when I got to the room, it was HUGE and barely and hardly any smell of smoke. So I didn't bother asking to change for the 2nd night. It was slightly annoying having to go up to 25th floor only to have to go back down in a different lift to 16th floor but just about bearable. Breakfast was great - the buffet was delicious and their fresh granola was divine. I travel quite a lot for business and this was one of the better breakfasts I've had. The room was very well equiped - comfy bed, molton brown in the bathroom, etc. And the shower was definitely a POWER shower. Great for waking up in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “High in the Sky”
Reviews.Author: cupcake3
Reviews.Content: An interesting thing about the Conrad in Miami is that the lobby is on the 25th floor, and the concierge is on the ground lobby. Weird, I thought at first. But when you think about it, Miami is a high crime city, and I think by having you walk past the concierge and all the ground floor emplyees, and taking one of two elevators to the 25th floor, and then having to walk past the front desk and lounge to get to the only two elevators to get to the guest rooms; it is probably about security and quiet. The smallish bar on the lobby level was great, cool sophisticated and outdoor tables where you can look at the water while you have a cocktail. Great martinis. The continental breakfast in the restaurant was also very good. At lunch or dinner DO NOT order the Kobe hamburger. I have had real Kobe beef in Japan (which is why I ordered it) and this was not it. Maybe they meant Kobe "like". It was also overpriced. The rooms was very nice, but a little smaller than I am accustomed to, but I guess it has to do with the high price of real estate in Miami. Hip modern decor, reminded me of the decor of the Beverly Hilton, but not nearly as fine, and the room is smaller. Good bedding with high count sheets, bathroom all granite and marble, very nice. I had a nice water view from (I think!) my room 1917. The exercise lockers were OK, not fabulous ,as was the pool. That whole area needs updating. The staff were very gracious and helpful. EXCEPT the concierge who was not dependable. I ordered a town car to take me back to the airport, and when I arrived downstairs at the appointment time, they were like "who did you talk to? We don't know anything about this." Tip: free wifi, but ONLY in the lobby. They charge you for it in your room. Tip: ask for a waterview room, rather than a city view. Worth it. Tip: if you do anything with the concierge, write down his/her name and the date and time you talked so you won't have to be on the defensive if they do not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Miami for the weekend and stayed at the Conrad Hilton for 3 nights. We visit often and usually try different hotels. The hotel occupies the top floors of the Espiritu Santo building on Brickell Ave. It is a good location on Brickell, and I expect that as Mary Brickell Village (a restaurant/shopping area a few blocks away) expands the location will even improve. We could tell that the hotel was reasonably new, but all the staff were very focused on service and our stay was great. There is a beautiful bar and restaurant on the lobby level (near the top of the building) with great views of Biscayne Bay and the city. The room was great. Everything was new and working well. I can't think of anything that disappointed us. Maybe if you didn't know the area and thought you would be close to the beach; this is a city hotel with a big city feel. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel with good service but some oddities”
Reviews.Author: emberito
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Miami is located in a spectacular building. The outside of the building was in real bad shape because of Hurricane damage but it was being repaired while we were there. There were a lot of windows blown out and I understand all the windows have to be redone--a major undertaking. Don't let that bother you because inside the hotel is beautiful. From the moment you walk in there are fresh flowers in very modern arrangements. They were changed two times while we were there. A door person holds the door and welcomes you, and people at the downstairs lobby are friendly as well. Here is the awkward thing: You entire on the ground level and take an elevator to upper level floor (don't remember what #); that is the lobby. I guess this must be a Conrad thing because the Chicago Conrad was the same. It does make you feel safe and secure in the hotel. The odd thing is you then take another elevator around the bend down to your room. The lobby has a spectacular view and a great restaurant for breakfast. The staff at the restaurant is exceptional; the food is good! The pool area is small but nicely designed with little cabanas and comfortable chairs. There is also a tennis court on that floor. This area was never very busy, which might be explained by another awkward thing in the design of the building. To get to the pool area from your room you have to: (1) take an elevator UP to the lobby, then (2) take an elevator DOWN to the ground floor, then (3) exit the building, (4) cross the drive, (5) enter the parking lot building, (6) take another slow elevator UP to the roof top, and then (7) you made it! Just make sure you take everything you need when you get to the pool because it is a long haul back to the room! I don't know what the architect was thinking when he/she designed that. It is completely absurd and inconvenient. Despite these peculiarities, which might be an inconvenience for the elderly or handicapped, the hotel room is beautifully appointed, the bathrooms are amazing, the toiletries (Molton Brown) are wonderful, and the bed linens are a dream. The bed was turned down each night and a tray of water, and chocolates were left on the bed. Another nice touch was that the ice bucket was filled every night. If I were staying around the downtown or Brickell areas I would certainly choose the Conrad. However, if you are wanting to hang out on South Beach or Coconut Grove, I'd say stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED IT....SOOOOOO NICE...”
Reviews.Author: jesolo78
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the conrad in the business district just for one night , i wished i had a week extra... the hotel in is a lovely area with free transport via the mono rail that takes you around the district.... the staff where so friendly and helpful. the rooms where excellent, spacious very very clean, the bed and linen was just so cosy and luxurious. breakfast was served like silver service and the food tasted so nice... what more can a say for a relax, good food, friendly staff you got everything with this hotel. if was was back in miami i wouldnt stay anywhere else. i travel all around the world and this hotel lives up to a five star not a four star....LOVED IT.... JULIE FROM LONDON

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss?”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a two week stay at the Conrad. First of all, during my stay, I read that 72% of all travellers spend two nights or less at any given property. For this group the Conrad provides a very well-oiled business-centric hotel experience. The IT guys will solve any problem you have in minutes and they're all over you. The rooms are all on the small side with bathrooms that are enormous and swamp the size of the room.If you luck out and get a corner room (#s 16 or 25), you'll have a fantastic view of water and highrises and sunrises from a bathroom with a wall of glass and wrap-around windows in your bedroom. The bedding is very comfortable and the rooms are amazingly quiet. There's no noise from inside or out. The Level 25 lobby and bar and restaurant area give you a great modern cityscape view on all sides. There's a great pool and jacuzzi, tennis courts and a spa. The swimming pool is heated to near bathwater temperature so it's perfect for an early morning or late night swim. There's a bar and restaurant on site which is actually across the motor court and up on the roof of the parking structure adjacent the hotel. The food here is all grilled right in front of you and very good. However this bar closes at sundown so you're out of luck if you come later to use the pool which opens at 6 am and closes at 10 PM. That is all the good part....now for the rest. The rooms have precisely two drawers for clothing. All other clothes are to be hung on hangers in your closet. Quite frankly, this was so woefully inadequate for a two week stay that the only solution was to have the mini-bar emptied to give myself another drawer. Similarly, I had to have another storage space in the entry hall cleared of the coffee maker and all that paraphenalia that people seem to think is essential in a business hotel but which I personally loathe looking at. I like a very clean uncluttered look and this can only be accomplished by losing all the black leather menus and phone pads and gewgaws that clutter every surface in these small rooms. The huge 37 inch TV and accompanying DVD player are among the most confusing to operate I have ever encountered. There's no universal remote and instead you have to use one to turn on another to switch channels. It's very frustrating and would be vastly imporved with written instructions but I had to ask twice to have these provided. There seems to be a problem with service in the hotel. While the universal response to any request you make is gracious and can-do, the execution seems to fall short. I had several requests that were made in duplicate. Finally, the food. The Atrio restaurant is a stunning space but the food is mediocre at best, overpriced and the only option besides a room service menu. I used room service twice and was disappointed in everything but a thin-crusted pizza bianca. The breakfasts are obscenely expensive. One morning I actually paid $18 for fruit juice and a wineglass sized porition of granola, berries and yogurt. There's no other eating option in the hotel and I thank god for the neighboring Novecento restaurant which is cati-corners across Brickell and which provides reasonable entrees, wonderful wines and good service to the beat of a very persistent latin rhythm and active bar scene full of young hot looking Latinos. So why the Conrad? We got a truly excellent rate for a party occupying 8 rooms for the 2 week period. I won't divulge what we paid but it was considerably less than the Columbus Hilton where we stay on frequnet trips to Ohio. That I would say is the real reason to love the Conrad. But if I had my druthers, I'd be down the block at the 4 Seasons in as fast as it took to walk there.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: CWS
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the hotel to take advantage of Hiltons Govt employee discount (about 50%) even though we are Canadian one of us works for Canadian Govt. Ended up with great rate of $205, next best decent 4 star Miami hotel was at $399. First time at this hotel but would def return. Very clean, modern contempory design. Lots of original touches which makes your stay a little more exciting. Great pool, gym, nice restaurant and all staff were excellent. Down in Miami for one night pre- cruise. Although in the commercial district Hotel is very convienient for cruise terminals, 15 min taxi ride. For the price would recommend over Miami beach hotels which personally apart from Loews, which busy and expensive, don't think are all that. We were very happy with the hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this very comfortable hotel for 2 nights between christmas and new year and had a very pleasant stay. As Conrad is part of the hIlton group of hotels ( and we are Hilton Honour Diamond members) we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. The accomodation was spacious and of a very high standard - with great views over city. I note from a previous review that the lifts and layout of the hotel caused confusion and inconvenience to other guests. I would endorse this in one respect - there were an inadequate number of lifts serving the bedroom floors, so very often this led to a long wait. All the staff we encountered during our stay were very helpful and there was a great selection at breakfast. The pool was nice and the public area around it very well maintained. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and although it is in the business district the efficient transport network ensures that you are within easy reach of central Miami. We have previously stayed in the Conrad Chicago and would not return to that particular Conrad. The Miami Conrad was a complete contrast and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay which was further enhanced by our upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is 'hit or miss'”
Reviews.Author: B-RobCleveland
Reviews.Content: The Conrad chain strives for a four star, Ritz-Carlton-level reputation, but this property falls short. First, I had stayed in the Conrad in Chicago; it was a superior experience, with respect to price, service, room quality, etc. I expected the same in Miami. We typically stay in South Beach, but decided to give downtown a try. I got a great rate on their website by booking over the internet and prepaying the room. I paid about $270 a night for a "bay view" room, which was closer to $330 on other websites. (Its not a clear "bay view" since there is an apartment building in the way. But you do see water.) The problems started before we checked in. There was a convention in the hotel, but they did not have enough valets to park the cars. We were told to park the car at the end of the block. Not good. But, on the plus side, they did have our bags in our room within 10 minutes of check in. Once we settled in, I called the concierge to see about a restaurant reservation. We asked about Azul, a great restaurant at the Mandarin Oriental (highly recommend Azul, by the way). The concierge said he would try, but could not guarantee given the hour. Fair enough. We also talked about top restaurants in South Beach. When I asked about other options in downtown, he mentioned there was a PF Changs up the street. Now why, if I choose Azul as my first choice, would he suggest PF Changs as a second choice? That made no sense. The elevators . . . what can I say. We saw the same gum wrapper on the floor Monday morning at check out that we saw Saturday night at check in. There was a broken glass panel in the other elevator. I just can't imagine that broken panel would be tolerated all weekend at the Ritz, the Four Seasons, or the Delano. Then there was the room. It was OK, but a bit noisy from the air conditioner and the elevator motors. The worst part was the daily "wake up call" by the housekeeping staff. Er . . . folks? If I call the front desk for a 10:30 wake up, that does not mean I want a knock on my door at 8:30! The oddest part: as I stood near the window and looked up near the valance, I could see exposed insulation and unfinished drywall. This could be a real problem for people with allergies, of course. I communicated all these issues to the hotel when I received an on-line survey e-mail. A few days later, I received an e-mailed letter apologizing for all the problems EXCEPT the exposed drywall. That, supposedly, is the way it was supposed to be . . . whatever . . . . A week later, I received the same letter at my house. But with the letter was a voucher for two free days in a king room! This was a pleasant surprise, of course, which I will take advantage of. In all, the hotel was, as a Brit we met in the bar put it, "hit or miss." They do care, but they just don't quite have it all together. That is a management and understaffing issue, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, but lacks the human warmth”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_0f_the_W0rld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is meant for business travelers. We stayed there for a conference, and when we were not working, we were at the hotel's restaurant. The hotel itself is very nice, comfortable beds, delicious room service, very nice bathrooms. All the amenities that American business traveleres expect and need from a good hotel. However, the hotel feels very cold, and expensive. It feels very large, and you have to take a long elevator ride up and down if you want to go anywhere. Not exactly a pleasant experience, you feel almost like you are trapped in this large tower. There is NOTHING to do in the neighborhood, one night we walked to a nearby restaurant, nothing to write home about. Although when the weather is nice you can sit outside at least. For business travelers I would recommend booking at the nearby Mandarine Oriental, it's got a much more "human" feel and touch. That's where our conference was anyway, and the reason we stayed at the Conrad was because the Mandarine ran out of vacancies.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not better than a Ritz for sure...”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: as some reviewers had me believing. It's basicly a Westin, in any big city, with comfortable rooms, marble bath rooms & room service in a quiet high rise far from the noise of South Beach. We stayed one night before our Carribean cruise & although I liked the common areas & the bar looked pretty nice, the room was not as wonderful as I had hoped for. The bed was very comfy, but thats the least I expect in a hotel. I mean, if you don't sleep well & feel comfortable in your hotel room whats the point? It was a little weird checking in on the 25th floor than going to the 22nd to our room as also reported & since the elevators don't all go to the same floors you have to repeat that process more than once. We did have a view of the harbor, which is what we asked & paid for, but the harbor is in the distance & well, your not going to feel a breeze or hear the ocean in this room. But we did want a quiet place to relax in & thats what we. For $300. though I would say it was overpriced. We also paid $30. for the taxi from the airport & another $20. to South Beach that night & the same amt. back & so on & so forth. Miami gets very expensive very quickly. I'll take New York taxi's any day over that experience & South Beach is way loud too & somewhat crazy, as you may expect. I can now better understand how Gianni Versace died. We walked by his mansion, right on the strip & the joint was jumping with a big loud party of some kind & this atmosphere is all around you on the strip, next to the beach. I'll take a nice, quiet, white, sandy beach anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: This was a one night, very last minute stay. We picked it b/c of the location and the name and rating. I live in the area so I knew basically what to expect. The hotel exceeded my expectations. The views when checking in were amazing. The room was fantastic. Well appointed and very comfortable. Can't really imagine what anyone would complain about with this property. Enjoy. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayaberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad with my boyfriend during Labor Day weekend of this year. We really enjoyed the place. The hotel was very close to South Beach and also very close to a lot of the the spots we wanted to hit (like Big Fish restaurant and Bayside Mall). Our room had a great view and was very clean. We have stayed at a few very nice hotels including the Ritz in Orlando and he said that this room was his favorite. It kind of had an asian theme. The bedding was nice and the bathroom was very big and clean, which is a big factor for me. The shower felt amazing. We even made use of the gym which was very clean. The hotel is very business class but we still thought it was romantic, even in the heart of Miami's financial district. The only thing we didnt enjoy was that the staff seemed a little snooty. The lady who checked us in was not very friendly and made us feel like we were bothering her. Also, the room service was UNBELIEVABLY expensive. All in all though, we enjoyed the hotel and felt very comfortable in it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kgmcguk
Reviews.Content: Used as a base for a business trip this Hotel ticked all the boxes. Good sized room, good food and the company were paying ! ! Staff were all excellent. It is a bit out of the way for nightlife and the beach area but the guys at the door will get you a taxi in seconds and prices were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: Elle08
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Conrad Miami and I must say that I will be back again. I'm not usually a fan of Hilton Hotels but this has changed my mind. The hotel staff was great and very helpful during my stay. The room size was large and very spacious. I even had a partial bay view which was very nice. Also, I was really impressed with how courteous and helpful everyone was during my visit. I was just there on business near the finanical district for one night but my only regret was that my stay was so short. Did I mention the wonderful view on balcony on the 25th floor? Check it out. I'm pretty picky and I must say that I was extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Walls like paper”
Reviews.Author: NOLA70115
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, STAY CLEAR OF THE MIAMI CONRAD. Other than that, the hotel was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern stylish Hotel in Downtime Miami”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on points before driving down to Key West. The Hotel is very modern and very stylishly decorated (as we expected). The service was very good â€“ check in was extremely smooth, one of the porters took us to our room and gave us a quick tour. The sea view from the bathroom was great and we really liked the huge windows. The food in the restaurant was on the whole very tasty although my wife's entree (Chilean Sea Bass) was too salty. The continental breakfast was excellent. The bed was very comfy, although the room was a touch on the small side. This was in part made up for by the large bathroom and we liked the separate shower cubicle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in April. I got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite which was probably the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Everything was immaculate. The view, the bathroom, the bed, everything. Checkin was a little odd, being on the 25th floor. My room was on the 21st, so I had to take an elevator up to 25, walk around a corner, then another elevator down to 21. No big deal considering what I had for a room. Great telescope to look out at the water or the city. Bring your ipod for the in room ipod stereo. The room service was also top notch. A+ stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Sophisticated Miami Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kecoco
Reviews.Content: I had a perfect stay at this beautiful hotel. Stayed 3 nights during the Sony/Erickkson tennis tournament in a 1 bedroom residence. This is a great hotel - front desk, Atrio restaurant and health club staff were friendly and professional. The atrium lobby is spectacular and a great place to sit, relax and have a late afternoon cocktail. Accomodations were wonderful - sophisticated muted decor with fine furnishings and a great bathroom with separate walk-in shower. I have stayed at the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton South Beach, Ritz Carlton Coconut Grove and my accomodations at the Conrad were far superior to any of the others. I will definitely go back. I have read comments about being in a business district but there are great restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and is a safe area for jogging and walking along the bay.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommmend!”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and I would stay here again. It is in a good location on hip Brickell Avenue, right on Biscayne Bay. Every employee I came into contact with was courteous, friendly, and professional. I was given a free upgrade to a studio which included a gorgeous little kitchen (granite counters, hardwood floors). The view was stunning even though I did not face the water, so I can only imagine how great the water view rooms are. The room was nicely decorated with a modern theme. The nightly turndown service was great with free chocolates and bottled water. The room was a pleasure to relax in at the end of a long day. I hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great in many things, but still having problems”
Reviews.Author: Abonda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights for a business meeting being held at this hotel. Other reviewers have given details I won't repeat here. Definately a luxury hotel with beautiful rooms and attentive service. Every employee we encountered gave us a smile and a greeting. BUT, there were a couple of areas that still need work. First, the list of hotel ammenities we saw in the on-line descriptions said "free wireless internet." Not true. In the room internet (either wireless or Ethernet) cost $14.95/24hours. There was a provision to enter a username and password if the business entity that was holding their meeting there provided one. We tried the code that our business was given. We always got a message that the account was not activated when we tried it. In spite of reporting this problem, it never got fixed in the 2 days we stayed there - had to pay the $14.95 anyway. Was also told that Wifi internet was free in the meeting rooms on the 3rd floor. We never were able to connect there - always got a message that the service was blocked. Finally the organizer of the business meeting told us that they had lots of problems with that side of the hotel operations. The rooms were not set-up as requested and the materials that were shipped in advance to the hotel were not in the meeting room at the start of the meeting, but there were 5 hotel employees there to greet them! Bottom line - a great place to stay if you can afford it AND realize that you have to specifically ask for everything you want them to do for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but could do better.”
Reviews.Author: L'amour99
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that this hotel is indeed a very nice hotel. The image Hilton give of the Conrad chain is that it is a 5* hotel and by the look, this is definitely a top end hotel. I arrived with family on Christmas day and stayed over the New Year. On check in while there was 2 staff members behind the desks only one on them was dealing with guests. The other member of staff saw us waiting, did not even say sorry for the wait we ended up waiting to check in for 15 mins! I booked 2 smoking rooms, they gave us 2 non smoking rooms- there was no longer any deluxe smoking rooms left, even though I booked months ago! Once checked in, we made our way to our room. It was a lovely room. Clean with a great view of the bay and Molton Brown amenities. Noticed the mini bar in the other room did not lock and made sure I let the hotel know about this before they started charging us for items, we had not taken! Around the windows, it seemed like to window were not fixed or plastered correctly or that they were still in the process of renovating the window area. They was also construction work during our stay, this was not a problem as they was not much noise, this might have been down to the fact that it was the holiday season, but the hotel should have made sure that they informed all guests of this matter. Also after leaving our room for a while, with the AC turned onto heat, I returned to find that my room was as cold as an ice box. It seemed like the AC had broken and the display reading was not as warm as displayed. Maintenance came to the room and within 1 min, stated that the problem was fixed. Needless to say the AC remained broken for the whole stay, after mentioning this to front desk for the second time and getting no response. I decided to turn the AC completely off and try to enjoy the rest of my stay, as it was winter, so the need for AC was not that great. (something, I would not have done, if I was staying during the warmer months) The location is good if you don't mind using the PT (public transport) as you are across the street from a metromover stop and can get to downtown, cocowalk and south beach very easily. We used the bus and train and metro mover to get around, as the hotel charges too much for parking. As for food, we ate at the restaurant in the morning, as we had HHonors breakfast vouchers. The breakfast is ok, but I have had better. Hard to find a decent coffee shop in the area and you have to be prepared to travel for some food, unless you want to eat at the hotel. There is a Walgreens and a Publics supermarket within walking distance, which made getting water easier, as water which is provided in room is $7 for a small bottle. We arranged to have new years dinner at the hotel and I expected it to be over priced and not worth it, but it was surprisingly decent. A 4 course champagne meal was around $100 per person. The turndown attendants were lovely and very friendly unlike to concierge who gave off a really bad attitude, when asked where the nearest sports bar was (sorry for asking!) All in all, I would go back to the Conrad, but not for the price paid. I have stayed in much nicer Hilton hotels and considering this is meant to be the top of their chain, it could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for business, OK for vacation”
Reviews.Author: gvr001
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Hotel Conrad Miami for a conference. First, the location. The hotel is located in downtown Miami, in the financial district. If you're here on business, that's fine. However, all the fun is in South Beach, which is a good 15-20 minute cab ride away, which costs $25-$30. This is where the good restaurants, night clubs, and beaches are. We all found the check in very odd. It is on the 25th floor. From there, you need to take a 2nd elevator to get to your room. So, to get to the gym, or to leave the building, you need to take 2 elevators, which can be an annoyance. The bar and restaurant are on this floor, and I didn't try either. The room itself was beautiful. Nice marble countertops, and a well designed bathroom. The only problem with the room was that the TV was pretty small. For a hotel of this quality and a large room, I was expecting a better TV. The hotel gym is decent. It is under construction, so it probably will be in better shape. The exercise equipment is modern, with each cardio machine having its own TV set. I did not visit the adjacent spa. All in all, it's a nice business hotel. However, for vacationers, there really is no reason to stay here, and I would head to south beach, and get a hotel there.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 5-star hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: iluvamex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks over the holidays at this '5-star hotel'. We had great rooms, part of the residences at the top of the tower, booked through Amex. Unfortunately, the service is the worst at this hotel. The maids speak no english, wake you up at 8:30 in the morning when the 'do not disturb' sign is up, refuse to leave new Q-tips or cotton balls, and do not actually clean up the room. Dirty plates and glasses were left day after day, and the complementary tea bags were not replaced until I screamed at the front desk. The maids also continued to replace the soft padding on the top of the mattress after we took it off everynight, until we threw it in the middle of the hallway after a week of taking it off before going to bed. Also, the washing machines in the residences are 'for pretend', and the housekeeping department can't speak enough english to tell you this, until you have waited for an hour for the clothes detergent, to go to the front desk, were the receptionist tells you that the machienes are for pretend. The restaurant is terrible too. The food is too heavy, saturated in oil, and will give you the runs. It takes 30 mins for an appatizer to arrive when the dining room is empty. The do not have room temperature bottled water. The waterfall is too loud, and most of the waiters cannot deal with special requests. The chef claims to not know how to put together a regular eggs benedict when they have a 'lobster benedict' on the menu. The hostess was nice though, I will give the restaurant that. I could go on. Really far. I hated this hotel-it should be demoted to 4 stars. I went to the Four Seasons (which was next door) basically everyday for breakfast, even though breakfast at my hotel was free, because my hotel disgusted me so much.

Reviews.Title: “You Have to be KIDDING Me!”
Reviews.Author: Akgambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise. It was NY Eve so everything was booked, and we decided that staying in this area would be ok. What a mistake. This is a business hotel, not for vacationers. Staff could care less. Check in was a nightmare - hours and hours later. I saw many angry people trying to check in. Pool bar and pool is a joke, especially the bartender. You have to go to the 25th floor to check in - across to another building for the pool - and there is no gift shop or sundries available on the premises. There is no "cafe" type dining, only the main restaurant. Which had ONLY special seating available on NY Eve. My husband wanted to get us coffee to go and they made him sit at a table in the restaurant, and order it to go in order to get it. The staff keeps telling you to go across to the Marriott for services... why not just STAY there? The front desk manager was nice when I ended my trip by visiting with her and giving her this information, but was more concerned about making sure my mini bar items were accounted for than apologizing or comping anything. This is an expensive hotel. Not worth the money. It is well appointed, and the maids were excellent - the room was clean and quite lovely. But that's not worth the price. Concierge was nice also. We stayed at the Intercontinental before the cruise and highly recommend that hotel instead. I am not a novice traveler - I know this hotel is not worth the price. Early check in fee $100, early check out fee $100 - they get you coming and going. They need to improve! Oh AND PS - THIS HOTEL IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION - do they mention that when you make a reservation - NO. That is why they don't have a main lobby or gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money for vacationers”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in Jan. 07. This hotel is very confusing with the lobby on the 25th floor then down to your room but then back up to the 25th floor to change elevators to go down to street level. You must also go across the entry and up the elevator to get to the pool which also seems silly. Very inconvenient layout. The rooms were nice but not well kept. My husband cut his ankle on a one inch piece of metal sticking out of the chair and I had to call maintenance to get a loud buzz coming out of the fan fixed. They did bring extra blankets when asked and we also got a rollaway as requested. I stay at hilton family hotels often but usually at the Hampton Inns because I do not like to be nickeled and dimed by mandatory valet parking (unless you want to pay more due to in/out pay for self-park), charges to use the internet and exorbitant room service charges. We only stayed here because friends were, (they were not impressed either). The help was mostly adequate but valet did not have our car ready either time we called for it and in both cases had 15+ minutes to get it. Once they had misplaced the keys and my husband had to go identify them off their board. What others said we also experienced, construction, no where to walk etc. I agree, stay in South Beach if at all possible. This hotel is probably ok if you are doing business downtown but not for vacationers. If they would pay attention to more details (i.e. furnishings, service, keeping construction areas cleaner) it would also be more enjoyable staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler or just R&R”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGetaways43
Reviews.Content: As the top of the Hilton chain, this property is very good, but it is no 5 star resort. It is fine for someone just looking for peace/quiet, good location( close to airport, Bayside and South Beach) and very good value( much less per night than JW Marriott , Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental). I had a Bay View Room which was clean and very well appointed. Housekeeping does a good job with follow through. Although I found an evening male concierge to be somewhat abrupt, everyone else was very courteous and kind. I was upgraded with no problems and everything was delivered as promised ( from food to extra pillows)The menu is somewhat trendy but the food is well presented and well prepared. The one negative that I can say is that Hilton seems to forget that some people are actually on vacation. The gym/spa and pool ( seperate bulidings) both close astonishingly early ! The pool closes at dusk and the gym at 8pm on weekends! I had no problem with this since I spend most of my time in my room reading when I can at night. There are very few scenic areas to walk around on the grounds, and I love to walk! I will return to this hotel again for myself, but I would not recomend family vacationers or anyone looking for a resort type setting.

Reviews.Title: “Staff not the friendliest”
Reviews.Author: dil345
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband, who was on a business trip, to this hotel. The location isn't good if you want to be on the water. The hotel had a European feel and the staff wasn't the friendliest.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Conrad Miami at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinThru80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad in Miami in November 2006 for a long weekend while doing business. I found a number of problems during my stay. The layout of the hotel is confusing: To get from my room to the pool, I had to take three elevator rides (from my room to the upper lobby; upper lobby to lower lobby; across to the other tower and up to the pool.) There was extensive construction during my stay. I woke at 7:30am on Saturday morning to jackhammers, which sounded like they were directly above me. While I was conducting interviews at the hotel (the whole purpose for my stay there) the loud construction continued. When I called to complain, I was met with a rude, "There's nothing we can do." Thankfully, enough people complained (apparently everyone in the hotel) and they eventually did cease construction. I requested a late checkout (since checkout is at noon and my flight was not until 7pm). I called the night before. Again, a rude employee curtly told me to call back in the morning. I called that morning. Yes, a late checkout could be arranged. The time? 1pm! Gee! An entire hour! How generous. Other problems throughout the stay: I had to continually ask for a newspaper to be delivered to my room in the morning. The restaurant staff at Atrio, the hotel's in-house eatery, were slow and inattentive. And if you're looking for recreational activities during down time, there's nothing within walking distanceof the hotel. A taxi ride is required to get to anywhere worthwhile. My advice? Stay in South Beach instead at one of the nice hotels on Collins Ave. Skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Vikster7
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great value for money - we got a beautiful suite for quite a cheap price. Gorgeous restaurant too. You have to go in separate lifts in a separate building to get to the pool which was a bit strange, and the bar wasn't open/nobody around BUT the pool is lovely if not quite small. Definately recommend as MUCH cheaper than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Comfortable & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: KaliFlaMex
Reviews.Content: First time at a Conrad Hilton hotel. The downtown location is ok, as always in Miami there's construction going on. You have to take the elevator up 20 flights to get to the lobby, then go to a seperate set of elevators to go down to your room. Our King, Bay View room had a view of the tennis courts and pool, plus the condo building directly in front of the hotel. So it was a partial view. The bed was yummy and sheets were luxurious (best part of the room). There was a desk and a comfortable lounge chaise in the room as well. The bathroom was covered in marble, seperate tub, long vanity counter top, good lighting. The stand up shower wasn't all that great. Good water pressure, but there's no place to put your shampoo, soaps, or to comfortably shave your legs (ladies). Plus, all the water leaked through the bottom of the glass shower door - put down lots of towels or you'll slip on those marble floors. Turn down service brought two free bottles of water ($8 in the mini-bar). Great continental breakfast, expect to sit down and order off the menu. If you're on the go, have them box it up, bkfst is great and free (if you have a pass, ask the front desk for one). There's also a coffee maker in the room if you don't want to walk down in the mornings. Morton's Steakhouse is across the street, but there's a restaurant in the hotel, too. You'll definitely need a car, or a cab, to get to the beaches. Overall, ok for business, but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MemberinNJ
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the service at the Conrad. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was exceptionally clean and we appreciated the turndown service which provided bottled water and slippers. All the upgraded amenities were a nice touch. I agree that the walls are slightly thin. However, no poblem sleeping in the comfortable beds. This hotel was about a $20 cab ride from South Beach and Key Biscayne. Breakfast at Atrio was amazing, dinner was just average.

Reviews.Title: “price high, service poor”
Reviews.Author: roltrader
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip with 2 colleagues in Miami. As the Four Seasons was booked we landed at the Conrad nearby. My 2 colleagues had severe problems checking in as the credit card acceptance did not work. So they had to draw cash and pay the room in advance. Next day it worked, when I checked in. The walls are thin and everything is very loud at night, nothing for people who donÂ´t sleep deeply. The house-keeping is worse than in a 2* hotel. For everything you need you have to call them (sometimes twice) as they do not fill up the bath accessories automatically, only upon request. Ckecking out a problem again, they were not able to provide my colleague a proper invoice because he paid cash (which was their fault). Excuse was: "..we are using the Hilton system which can not handle this.."" Also late check out (only 2 hlours) took me 30min to arrange. I travel a lot business-wise in the US, Europe and Asia usually stay in 4* hotels. For 279$ this hotel is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in--Bar None!!”
Reviews.Author: BMWUtopia
Reviews.Content: If you ever have the chance to stay in the Conrad Miami, treat yourself to this hotel. The service was outstanding, the staff very attentive, rooms perfect--it's what I would imagine heaven to be like. Try the restaurant--you will not be disappointed!! It features outstanding views of the city. The bar upstairs is equally nice. The hotel also has an awesome workout room and spa. Truly this is one of the best hotels--better than Ritz Carltons, JW Marriotts, and Intercontinentals (and those are great hotels too). This is a rare treat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start off a cruise vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Gingerbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad the night before we were to set sail on a cruise out of the Port of Miami. It was a great treat and a great way to kick off our vacation. Anytime we ever cruise out of Miami or Fort Lauderdale, we always stay the night before. I was searching and found the Conrad. It had just opened a couple of months earlier and offered a "Grand Opening" rate of only $100 for the normal $400 room. I booked it. The only flaw is the multi lifts that you have to use to get around. Other than that, it was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're a light sleeper, this isn't the place for you. The clientele is louder than at the J.W. Marriot or Four Seasons, and the walls are paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is the place to stay in downtown Miami (not SoBe)........I stayed there for a week....its a nice location on Brickell with wonderful vistas of Biscayne bay........but this location is true to most of the hotels in this area here including the Intercontinenatal on Bisayne Bay Blvd....... This Hotel is class apart in service......I haven't seen more nicely adorned rooms....with an attention to detail like no other in the buisness......and a breathtaking exterior to the building. There is some renovation going on due to the effects of Wilma....but I did not encounter any hassles due to that...............The bed and the quality of the accessories in room top class..........I loved the small study lamps that are attached to the bed. ......... The people who service the room show a great attention to your needs and the attention can be seen in the way everything is set up when you return to ur room I can't believe the price is still reasonable..........the view from the Sky lobby on 25 th floor is just great and and the staff are very courteous all the time. .........in the past 6 months.......The ritz carlton in DC and westin orlando were nice......but this by far was the best..... GO CONRAD..............hope they keep it up

Reviews.Title: “Don't VALET at CONRAD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Conrad was great, with one major exception. Upon leaving, we waited 30 minutes for the valet.... No car...No sign of the valet... After asking the head valet, Nicolas, "What's going on???" he replied, "Oh, your car has a flat, didn't they tell you..?" Unfortunately, the valet also misplaced the key for another 20 minutes or so which delayed my ability to change the tire and get on the road with my wife and kids. All the while Nicolas, provided no help and was actually quite rude and uncaring. When I asked his name, he replied, "You want to take my name tag too..?" However, the most distressing thing was that I found out that they tried to use FIX A FLAT on my SUV's COMPLETELY flat tire!!! Without ASKING!!! Look, I know, flats happen, but I can't help but shudder to think what could have happened if the fix-a-flat worked and we drove off onto the highway back home (about 100 miles, btw). I definitely got the feeling they were not going to tell me about the flat---why else would they try to fix it before bringing the car around??? Or asking? Dissapointing, unprofessional and, frankly, DANGEROUS behavior. P.S. I'm still waiting for the assistant manager's call back (he was made aware of the situation as it unfolded). Nice guy, took my cell#, but I haven't heard anything... I know the Valet is a concession, not run by Hilton, but I think it is just another example of how these hotels are cutting back on service and training of their staff and those they outsource these jobs to. Enjoy the hotel, just don't give your keys to the valet!

Reviews.Title: “classy without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad a month after Hurricane Wilma came through Miami. The hotel had sustained significant damage, but they did a great job at hiding it from the guests. The staff was so unbelievably pleasant and helpful. They had no attitude and treated us quite well. The rooms were gorgeous. Very hip, but not cheesy. Great location - unless you want to be in the heart of south beach. If you prefer a quieter, more serene area, this is the place to go. We ate at the restaurant one night. It was very comfortable with a great menu and tasty food. The staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “P-E-R-F-E-C-T- !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel is perfection in the making. every detailed was catered to and attended too. ATRIO IS GREAT ! the food and staff are excellent! We expected a little less since the hotel is still new and coming back from the hurricane but it really made us say WOW. DEFINITLY RECOMMENDED !!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury. Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad from November 25th -28th 2005 and from the time of arrival my stay was fantastic. On arrival I was greeted by friendly professional staff and check in was effortless, within minutes I was in my room. Check-out was even easier. I didn't even have to go to the front desk. A bill was sent to my room I approved it and that was it. The room was exactly as it appeared on the hotel's website and was beautifully furnished. I have never seen a room in that price range so well appointed. Very contemporary and tasteful. The bed was the most comfortable bed in all my hotel stays. The bathroom was big and had a separate bath and marble shower. Temple Spa amenities were replenished daily. The Atrio restaurant was great. The breakfast I ordered was honestly the best breakfast I have ever had at a hotel. The Noir bar was sleek and contemporary and was a great alternative as suppose to going out. In room dinning menu was great, it offered a good selection. However I found the additional charges for room service to be a bit steep. The hotel provided complimentary wireless internet access in all rooms and this was quite a relief as I usually encounter stress regarding internet access at hotels I have stayed at before. The gym was very nice. Great variety of machines. Fresh fruit and water was provided complimentary in the gym. The spa attendant periodically walked around offering cold towels. Nice touch! The hotel is stylish and modern and I found that very appealing. I would definitely recommend this hotel since from personal experience there is no other hotel in Miami where you can you get this level of service and luxury for this price.
